0.title: Passenger gets India-SA score update on tissue paper from pilot onboard flight, shares pic
0.article_body: A Team India fan shared a picture of a handwritten India-South Africa T20 World Cup 2022 match score update given to him by a pilot on a tissue paper onboard an IndiGo flight. "India lost today...but IndiGo ⁦won my heart. Pilot sent...note mid-air when requested for score update," he tweeted. "We're glad to see this," IndiGo responded to his tweet.

1.title: US Prez got angry in June phone call with Zelenskyy, said 'show gratitude': Report
1.article_body: US President Joe Biden raised his voice at Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during a phone call in June, NBC News reported. Biden had reportedly just finished telling Zelenskyy about America's new $1 billion military aid when the latter started listing additional help needed by Ukraine. Biden became angry and said Zelenskyy "could show a little more gratitude", the report added.

2.title: Hope you are watching everything, Sai Baba: Prithvi Shaw after Team India snub
2.article_body: In an apparent reaction to him not being selected in Team India squads for New Zealand and Bangladesh tours, Prithvi Shaw shared a picture of Sai Baba on Instagram Stories. He wrote, "Hope you are watching everything, Sai Baba." The 22-year-old batter last played for India in July 2021.

3.title: 19-year-old Dewald Brevis smashes fastest 150 in T20 cricket history
3.article_body: Titans batting all-rounder Dewald Brevis on Monday smashed the fastest 150 in the history of T20 cricket. The 19-year-old South African crossed the 150-run mark off 52 deliveries against Knights in a CSA T20 Challenge match to break the record previously held by Chris Gayle (53 deliveries). Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, scored 162(57) in the match.

4.title: Will do films my heart says yes to, not for any other reason: Rajkummar
4.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao in an interview said, "I'm just going to do films I believe in, that my heart says yes to and not for any other reason." The actor will next be seen in 'Monica O My Darling', a neo-noir crime comedy directed by Vasan Bala. Rajkummar is also set to star in 'Guns & Gulaabs' and 'Bheed'.

5.title: Some couldn't come, we couldn't invite some: Ali as he shares pics from reception
5.article_body: Ali Fazal, taking to Instagram, shared a video featuring pictures from his wedding reception which took place in the first week of October. In the pictures, Ali and his actress-wife Richa Chadha were seen posing with Hrithik Roshan, Tabu and others. "I want to thank everyone...Some couldn't come, we were unable to invite some...but our love is...with you," Ali wrote.

6.title: Tamil Nadu logs 152 COVID-19 cases in 24 hrs; active cases decline
6.article_body: Tamil Nadu reported 152 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, taking the state's total case tally to 35,92,043, the state health department informed on Monday. No deaths due to the infection were recorded. Tamil Nadu's active case count fell from 1,732 on Sunday to 1,602 on Monday, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

7.title: Norway raises military alert level in response to Ukraine war
7.article_body: Norwegian PM Jonas Gahr Store on Monday announced that his country's military would be put on a higher level of alertness from Tuesday in response to the war in Ukraine. "There are no indications that Russia is expanding its warfare to other countries, but the increased tensions make us more exposed to threats, intelligence operations and influence campaigns," Store added.

8.title: We didn't get the start with bat: Ireland captain Balbirnie on loss vs Aus
8.article_body: Ireland captain Andy Balbirnie said his side didn't get the start with the bat in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against Australia. "But to show the fight at the end was nice. Looking at the scoreboard we thought it wasn't against us," he added. Chasing 180, Ireland were bowled out for 137 in 18.1 overs.

9.title: It wasn't the easiest wicket: Finch after scoring 63(44)
9.article_body: After scoring 63(44) and winning the 'Player of the Match' award, Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that it wasn't the easiest wicket to bat at the Gabba. "It was a lot slower than what we expected. They (Ireland) changed their pace really well and bowled a lot of cutters...it was hard to get a rhythm," Finch said.

10.title: Who knows if someone had stayed with Tucker: Balbirnie after losing to Aus
10.article_body: After losing to Australia by 42 runs, Ireland skipper Andy Balbirnie said the match was hardly fought. "Looking at the scoreboard we thought it wasn't against us, again the wickets column was a problem and who knows if someone had stayed with [Lorcan] Tucker," Balbirnie said. Notably, Tucker scored 71*(48) against Australia at Gabba on Monday.

11.title: Not here to be liked, having a great time with my team: Verstappen
11.article_body: F1 world champion Max Verstappen said abuse from Lewis Hamilton fans does not bother him. "I am not here to be liked, and it's not going to ruin my day. I am having a great time with my team," said Verstappen. He added that the abuse could be due to "frustration" as Hamilton "is not doing so well" this year.

12.title: Need to convert more chances: Ind hockey skipper Harmanpreet
12.article_body: After being beaten for the first time in the ongoing FIH Hockey Pro League, Indian hockey skipper Harmanpreet Singh said that the team needs to "convert more chances" into goals. "We were trying for different variations and combinations. But sometimes, they do not work out," Harmanpreet said. Notably, India lost to Spain by 2-3 in Bhubaneswar on Sunday.

13.title: BAI announces ₹5 lakh cash reward each for Sankar Muthusamy, Satwik-Chirag
13.article_body: Badminton Association of India (BAI) announced ₹5 lakh cash reward each for Sankar Muthusamy and doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty for their recent performances. Sankar became only the second Indian male singles player to win a silver at World Junior Championships. Rankireddy-Shetty became the first Indian doubles pair to win a Super 750 title at French Open.

14.title: Kerala policewoman wins 2 gold medals at World Arm Wrestling Competition
14.article_body: Kerala Police Assistant Sub-inspector Mini Raju won two gold medals at the World Arm Wrestling Competition held in Turkey. "This is the first time we (India) won so many medals. Also after 1979, I am the first one to win double gold for the country at the event," said Raju. She picked up the sport during a competition in 2018.

15.title: Partha Chatterjee's judicial custody extended in WB SSC scam case
15.article_body: A special CBI court extended the judicial custody of suspended TMC leader Partha Chatterjee by 14 days in the West Bengal School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam case. Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee were arrested by ED in July. Cash worth around ₹50 crore, jewellery and gold bars were also seized from flats allegedly owned by Mukherjee.

16.title: We now have to nurture Tejashwi Yadav: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
16.article_body: Bihar CM and JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar said that they now have to nurture Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav. Notably, JD(U) recently broke its ties with the NDA-led BJP and joined hands with the RJD-led coalition, which also includes Congress, to form the government in Bihar. Rejoining the NDA in 2017 was a "mistake", CM Nitish said.

17.title: Something may happen on sedition law in Winter Session: Centre
17.article_body: Attorney General R Venkataramani told the Supreme Court that the Centre is reviewing Section 124A of the Indian Penal Code which criminalises sedition and said that something may happen in the Parliament's Winter Session. The AG asked for additional time for the Centre so that appropriate steps can be taken. The matter was fixed for further hearing in January 2023.

18.title: 10 dogs & 2 puppies shot dead in Andhra medical college, case filed
18.article_body: A case has been filed against the management of GSL Medical College and others in Andhra Pradesh's Rajahmundry after 10 dogs and two puppies were shot dead on campus. The 'shooters' have reportedly been killing dogs for years as animals create "problems" for students. An alleged video of the dogs tied to a vehicle and being dragged has gone viral.

19.title: Rajasthan BJP legislator's son arrested in dowry harassment case
19.article_body: Rajasthan Police have arrested Prakash Garg, son of BJP legislator Jogeshwar Garg, in a dowry harassment case. Prakash surrendered before the police after the Rajasthan HC vacated the stay on his arrest. Prakash's wife Mamta, who is the daughter of Rashtriya Loktantrik Party (RLD) legislator Pukhraj Garg, had filed a complaint against him and his parents in 2020.

20.title: BJP leader, lawyer call for 'Truth Commission' over 1984 riots
20.article_body: BJP leader RP Singh and lawyer HS Phoolka have written to Home Minister Amit Shah and PM Narendra Modi respectively calling for a 'Truth Commission' into the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. Phoolka alleged "enough evidence" shows riots "probably" took place "under instructions" from former PM Indira Gandhi. Singh sought the declassification of documents pertaining to Operation Blue Star and the riots.

21.title: Amendment to counter 'perverse trends' will be proposed: Turkey Prez
21.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Monday said his party will propose constitutional amendments to protect families from "perverse trends". "While...unity between woman & man...is [being] scorned; perversion...& crooked relationships are being encouraged," he said. Erdogan and his party members have referred to members of the LGBT community as "deviants" or "perverts" in recent years.

22.title: ICC allows prosecutor to resume probe into Afghanistan atrocities
22.article_body: The International Criminal Court (ICC) on Monday allowed its prosecutor Karim Khan to resume his probe into atrocities committed in Afghanistan. The court observed that Kabul "is not presently carrying out genuine investigations" into the alleged crimes. The now-deposed Afghan government had asked the ICC to pause the investigation in 2020 so that Kabul could carry out its own inquiries.

23.title: India in talks to expand bilateral trade through rupee accounts: Report
23.article_body: The Indian government is reportedly in talks with African nations like Zimbabwe, Djibouti, Ethiopia, Malawi and Sudan to expand bilateral trade through bespoke rupee accounts. Along with this, it is also reportedly trying to internationalise indigenous payment methods. The discussions are aimed at replacing SWIFT by creating a separate payment ecosystem and overcoming dollar-dominated trades.

24.title: RBI imposes ₹5 lakh fine on LIC Housing Finance for violating norms
24.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) imposed a fine of ₹5 lakh on LIC Housing Finance for not complying with provisions of the National Housing Bank. A ₹1.76 crore fine was also imposed on Vakrangee Ltd by the central bank. RBI clarified the penalties were not intended to pronounce the validity of transactions or agreements entered into with its customers.

25.title: In pressure situations, make use of technology: Hogg on no-ball call
25.article_body: Citing instances from India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match, former Australia cricketer Brad Hogg said that in pressure situations, technology should be used to make the right decisions. "We have TV replays that can give us the right result," he stated. Hogg cited examples of waist-high no-ball signalled against Pakistan, Axar Patel's run out and Ravichandran Ashwin dropping Shan Masood's catch.

26.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states for next 2 days, list released
26.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs for next two days. It is very likely over parts of Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Mizoram, Manipur, Tripura and West Bengal on October 25. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Nagaland on October 26.

27.title: What is Virat Kohli's record while chasing in T20 World Cup history?
27.article_body: Virat Kohli has scored 541 runs at a strike rate of 135.92 in T20 World Cup matches in which India have batted second. Kohli has scored these runs in 10 innings, out of which he has remained not out in eight. Kohli's highest score in these matches is 82*(53), registered against Pakistan on Sunday, and his batting average is 270.50.

28.title: How do the latest T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 points tables read?
28.article_body: New Zealand are on top of the T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 points table with a superior net run-rate than Sri Lanka and England. Australia are last on the points table. Bangladesh lead Group 2, having superior net run-rate than India. Meanwhile, South Africa and Zimbabwe have one point each after their match ended producing no result.

29.title: If India think they can win WC without Virat, it's not possible: Inzamam-ul-Haq
29.article_body: Calling Virat Kohli "zabardast", ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said, "If India think that they can win the World Cup without Virat, it's not possible." He added, "The Indian team is dangerous only on one condition, when Virat plays brilliantly. I'm telling this clearly." Kohli remained unbeaten at 82 to help India chase down Pakistan's 160-run target in their T20 WC match.

30.title: Congress is simply busy walking on the path of illusion: K'taka minister
30.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar criticised Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra, claiming that the party is simply busy walking on the path of illusion. "With Bharat Jodo Yatra coming to an end in Karnataka, the big question remains whether it really served any purpose other than Congress’ classic divide and rule politics?” said Sudhakar.

31.title: Pakistan convinces Saudi Arabia to revive former's $12 bn refinery: Report
31.article_body: Pakistan has persuaded Saudi Arabia to revive the former's $12 billion refinery and petrochemical complex, an investment that was shelved during Pakistan PM Imran Khan's regime, according to reports. Saudi Arabia had planned the investment in 2019. They backed out after Khan allegedly tried to form a bloc of Islamic countries, outside Saudi-dominated Organisation of Islamic Cooperation's ambit.

32.title: Twitter user points out a typo in Shashi Tharoor's tweet on Virat Kohli, he replies
32.article_body: A Twitter user by the handle @perthinent pointed out a typo in Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's tweet on Virat Kohli. The user stated she thought Tharoor misspelled "authentic" as "authetic" in the tweet, adding, "But 'authetic' is a real word and makes sense in this context." Tharoor replied, "Thanks for coming to the rescue...@perthinent, but it was, alas, a typo!"

33.title: PM Modi congratulates Rishi Sunak, calls him 'living bridge' of UK Indians
33.article_body: PM Narendra Modi congratulated Rishi Sunak, who will become the first UK Prime Minister of Indian descent. PM Modi tweeted, "As you become UK PM...I look forward to working closely together on global issues, and implementing Roadmap 2030." He added, "Special Diwali wishes to the 'living bridge' of UK Indians, as we transform our historic ties into a modern partnership."

34.title: For now, we have a set XI: Mitchell Marsh on Smith's chances of playing vs SL
34.article_body: Australia all-rounder Mitchell Marsh has said that it's unlikely that Steve Smith, who missed their T20 World Cup match against New Zealand, will play in their second match against Sri Lanka on Tuesday. "We're early on in the tournament, things can change, but for now we have a set XI," he stated. Australia lost against New Zealand by 89 runs.

35.title: TN students attack toll plaza staff in Andhra; video surfaces
35.article_body: A video has surfaced showing students of a law college from Tamil Nadu allegedly attacking toll plaza workers in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati over payment-related issues. The students were returning after an exam when they were stopped at the toll plaza. The clash continued for a while and some vehicles were damaged even after police reached the spot.

36.title: Bug in iOS 15.7.1 beta update causing Face ID malfunction: Report
36.article_body: Several iPhone users reportedly faced issues with their Face ID after installing the iOS 15.7.1 beta update. Reports said a bug in the beta update resulted in users facing problems resetting their Face ID on their devices. They were greeted with a "Face ID not available" error every time they tried to use facial recognition on their iPhones.

37.title: I would be happy if Kumaraswamy becomes K'taka CM: BJP MLC
37.article_body: BJP MLC M Chidananda Gowda said that he would be happy if JDS leader HD Kumaraswamy becomes Karnataka's CM. "Our community (Kunchitiga) should also be included in the list of Other Backward Class (OBC)," the BJP MLC said.  He further added that whosoever becomes the CM should include the Kunchitiga community in the OBC list.

38.title: Why were Zimbabwe awarded 5 penalty runs against SA in their T20 WC match?
38.article_body: Zimbabwe were awarded five penalty runs against South Africa in ninth over in their T20 World Cup match on Monday. This came after wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock threw his glove before collecting a throw, and the ball went on to hit the stray glove. South Africa were penalised as ball hit an object intentionally placed on the field of play.

39.title: India's best-kept secret: Odisha CM on pics of Chilika Lake
39.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik recently took to Twitter to share some pictures of Chilika Lake. "Chilika Lake has been integral to Odisha's culture & literature. It is a nature lovers' paradise and host to a fascinating carnival of avian guests," he tweeted. Calling the lake "India's best-kept secret", he said, "This winter let's spend time with the symphony of nature."

40.title: John Shaw loved India, was compassionate, friendly: Infosys ex-CFO Pai
40.article_body: Former Infosys Chief Financial Officer Mohandas Pai on Monday said Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's husband John Shaw "loved India" and was a "very compassionate and friendly person". "John was a...business leader who understood business strategy...and worked hard with Kiran to build Biocon," Pai said. John Shaw passed away on Monday.

41.title: K'taka government approves 11 projects to generate over 41,000 jobs in state
41.article_body: The Karnataka government has approved 11 development projects which are expected to bring in investment worth over ₹1.74 lakh crore. The new projects are expected to benefit the youth in the state by generating over 41,000 jobs. According to reports, out of 11 projects, eight are going to be related to clean energy.

42.title: Shinde as Maha CM is BJP's 'temporary arrangement': Uddhav-led Sena
42.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, in its mouthpiece 'Saamana', claimed that 22 out of the 40 MLAs in Eknath Shinde-led Sena will soon join the BJP. In its weekly column, Uddhav-led Sena claimed that Eknath Shinde as Maharashtra CM was a "temporary arrangement" made by the BJP. Everyone has understood that his Chief Ministerial uniform will be taken, Sena said.

43.title: Kannur University VC called me to facilitate an attack: Kerala Guv
43.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Monday said he called Kannur University's Vice Chancellor "criminal". "What other word should I use for a person who invites me to Kannur to facilitate an attack on me?...After Kannur incident, [he] wrote back to Raj Bhavan that [he is] not a security expert, so he can't give a report," Khan added.

44.title: Mohammad Hafeez criticises Babar Azam, says 'His captaincy is like a sacred cow'
44.article_body: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez criticised Pakistan captain Babar Azam after their defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022. "Babar Azam's captaincy is like a sacred cow that cannot be criticised," he said, adding, "It's the third consecutive big game in which we're seeing flaws in his captaincy...but we keep hearing that by time he gets to 32, he'll learn."

45.title: PM Modi meets Army Major after 21 years in Kargil, pic goes viral
45.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Major Amit on Monday while on a visit to Kargil on the occasion of Diwali. PM Modi had earlier met Major Amit in 2001 when the latter was a student at a Sainik school in Gujarat's Balachadi. PM Modi and the Major posed together with a photo which comprised their picture from 2001.

46.title: Govt should solve hunger issues and not discredit bodies: Kharge
46.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said that the central government should solve hunger problems in the country instead of discrediting the organisation. Asking the BJP to focus on the hunger crisis, Kharge added, "In the last 8 years, we have seen that there has been slow progress on this front." India ranked 107 among 121 countries on the Global Hunger Index.

47.title: China chip imports fell 12.4% in Sept year-on-year: Govt data
47.article_body: According to official customs data, China's chip imports fell 12.4% in September to 47.6 billion chip units, compared to 54.3 billion units in September 2021. The data was supposed to be released earlier this month but was delayed due to the Communist Party Congress. In the first nine months of 2022, total output was down 10.8%.

48.title: US teenager pleads guilty to mass shooting at high school
48.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, Ethan Crumbley, on Monday pleaded guilty to murder and terrorism charges in a mass shooting that killed four of his classmates at a high school outside the US city of Detroit. Six other people were injured in the attack that occurred last November. Crumbley pleaded guilty to a total of 24 charges in Oakland County Circuit Court.

49.title: Mbappe to get €630 million by end of 2025 contract with PSG: Report
49.article_body: French club PSG's reported contract with forward Kylian Mbappe, which runs till 2025, will see the player get €630 million by the end of it. The agreement reportedly states Mbappe's wages to be a net €72 million per annum, a signing bonus of €180 million and a loyalty bonus. Mbappe has scored 10 goals in the league this season.

50.title: Alibaba, Tencent shares stumble as Xi reshuffles China's politburo
50.article_body: As Xi Jinping began his third term as China's leader, he pushed market reformists from the politburo standing committee, leading to stocks of companies such as Alibaba and Tencent plunging 12% and 10% respectively. The Hang Seng stock index in Hong Kong was also the lowest since 2009 as it crashed by 6.2%. Investors fear tightened scrutiny of private companies.

51.title: Sensex jumps 525 points, Nifty ends above 17,700 during muhurat trading
51.article_body: The BSE and NSE on Monday conducted a one-hour special muhurat trading session from 6:15 pm, marking the beginning of Samvat 2079 - the Hindu calendar year that starts on Diwali. While the Sensex jumped 525 points to close at 59,832, the Nifty settled at 17,731 after rising 155 points. The gains were driven by the banking and financial stocks.

52.title: Ex-Tinkoff executives raise $16 mn to launch fintech startup
52.article_body: Three former executives at Tinkoff have raised $16 million to launch a fintech startup focused on Southeast Asia. The trio includes Co-founder George Chesakov, Pavel Fedorov, joint Tinkoff CEO in 2021-22 and Raffy Montemayor. Tinkoff is owned by London-listed TCS Group Holding and the company said that it was planning to expand to Asia a week before the Ukraine invasion.

53.title: Reliance shares rise after demerger announcement
53.article_body: Shares of Reliance Industries rose by 0.8% at ₹2,483.6 during the special muhurat trading session on October 24 after the company said that it will demerge and list its financial services business under Jio Financial Services. On October 21, RIL announced that shareholders will get one share of Jio Financial Services for each share they held in the company.

54.title: Qatar arrested & abused LGBT people ahead of FIFA World Cup: HRW
54.article_body: Human Rights Watch (HRW) said security forces in Qatar arbitrarily arrested and abused LGBT Qataris as recently as last month. A Qatari official responded that HRW's allegations "contain information that is categorically and unequivocally false". HRW said "nondiscrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity" should be for all and not just spectators going for the FIFA World Cup.

55.title: Mahindra tweets Churchill's quote from 1947 as Sunak set to become UK PM
55.article_body: Anand Mahindra reacted to Rishi Sunak's confirmation as UK's next PM through a tweet. "In 1947 on the cusp of Indian Independence, Winston Churchill supposedly said, "All Indian leaders will be of low calibre & men of straw"," tweeted Mahindra. "Today...during the 75th year of Independence...we're poised to see a man of Indian origin anointed as UK's PM," he added.

56.title: Kyiv urges global ban on Russia's RT after anchor's call to drown Ukrainian children
56.article_body: Ukraine has urged a global ban on the Russian channel RT after one of the channel's news anchors allegedly said that Ukrainian children who saw Russians as occupiers under Soviet Union should have been drowned. Ukraine has termed the channel an 'incitor of genocide'. RT's Editor-In-Chief Margarita Simonyan said she had suspended the presenter, Anton Krasovsky, for his "disgusting" comments.

57.title: Plane overshoots runway at airport in Philippines, nobody injured
57.article_body: A Korean Air passenger plane overshot the runway at the Mactan-Cebu International Airport in the Philippines late on Sunday, the airline informed. The 162 passengers and 11 crew members on board the aircraft escaped using emergency slides. The airport was closed in the aftermath of the incident as the aircraft remained stuck at the end of its lone usable runway.

58.title: Cheteshwar Pujara re-signs with Sussex for 2023 County season
58.article_body: Sussex have retained the services of India batter Cheteshwar Pujara for the 2023 season. "I am glad to be back with Sussex for the 2023 season. I thoroughly enjoyed my stint with the club last season," said Pujara. Last year, the batter scored over 1000 County Championship runs, including a record-breaking three double centuries, at an average of 109.4.

59.title: Cristiano Ronaldo only keen on joining a European club: Report
59.article_body: Journalist Fabrizio Romano said Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo is still keen to join a European club despite reports linking him to other leagues. "Ronaldo's priority has always been to continue in Europe. I'm sure his agent will explore the market in the next 1-2 months," said Romano. Ronaldo's contract with Manchester United expires at the end of the season.

60.title: B'luru residents form human chain to protest against potholes in city
60.article_body: Residents in Bengaluru have been complaining to the civic authorities regarding the pothole menace in the city. In a recent incident, residents of the city, including children and the elderly, formed a human chain on Sunday demanding an immediate solution to the potholed roads. According to the residents, they approached the civic authorities several times in the last six months.

61.title: Umpire made the right decision: Taufel on India's byes after Kohli got bowled on free hit
61.article_body: Former Australian umpire Simon Taufel stated that the umpire made the right decision in giving India three byes and not signalling a dead ball after Virat Kohli got out on free hit in last over against Pakistan. "For a free hit, the striker cannot be out bowled and therefore the ball is NOT dead on hitting the stumps," he stated.

62.title: SC revokes Gauhati HC order granting bail to accused arrested with morphine
62.article_body: The Supreme Court revoked a Gauhati High Court order granting bail to two men accused of possessing morphine. The accused were released on bail after being in jail for about a year. ''In our considered view, in the face of the mandate of Section 37 of the [NDPS] Act, the High Court...[shouldn't have granted] bail," the apex court said.

63.title: Two loud blasts heard in Syrian capital Damascus
63.article_body: Two blasts were heard across Syria's capital Damascus on Monday, and state media said they could have been caused by an Israeli strike. Israel has been carrying out strikes for years against what it calls Iranian and Iran-backed targets in Syria, where Tehran has stationed forces to support Syrian President Bashar al-Assad since the onset of the Syrian Civil War.

64.title: Rishi Sunak to become first UK Prime Minister of Indian descent
64.article_body: Rishi Sunak has won the race to be leader of the Conservative Party and will become UK's next Prime Minister. His only rival, Penny Mordaunt, conceded and withdrew on Monday. Sunak will become the first UK PM of Indian descent. Earlier, Liz Truss resigned from the post after 45 days in office amid massive economic crisis.

65.title: Girl dies after molestation attempt, Meerut Police probe university staff
65.article_body: The Meerut Police said that they are probing the role of the staff of a private university after a 19-year-old jumped off the fourth floor, following an alleged molestation attempt. The police said that the university did not inform them about the incident. According to the FIR, she was being pestered by another student, who allegedly molested her.

66.title: VCs of 9 universities can continue in their posts until Guv's final order: Kerala HC
66.article_body: The Kerala HC on Monday held that Vice-Chancellors of nine universities can continue in their positions until the Governor issues a final order following a show-cause notice that was issued on Monday. Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Monday issued notices to the VCs to show cause by November 3 on their legal right to continue in office.

67.title: 31-yr-old Pune man assaults police officer, tears his uniform; held
67.article_body: The Pune Police have arrested a 31-year-old man for allegedly assaulting a traffic police officer and tearing his uniform at Karachi Chowk in Pimpri. The incident took place on Saturday when the accused approached the officer for stopping the traffic flow from one direction and allegedly abused him. He then held the officer by his collar and tore his uniform.

68.title: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari seen with TMC leaders in Birbhum
68.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari was seen with two TMC councillors of Suri municipality at Bamni Kali Temple in West Bengal's Birbhum district. Calling the meeting a "coincidence", the TMC councillors Ujjwal Chatterjee and Kundan Dey said it was "without any political significance". Dey added, "We don't take politics to the temple. TMC has always been courteous to Opposition leaders."

69.title: Alpine F1 protest against Alonso being stripped of US GP points
69.article_body: Alpine F1 have protested against Haas's appeal about the safety of Fernando Alonso's car being upheld, leading to the driver losing his seventh place at the US Grand Prix. Haas had objected post-race to Alonso and Red Bull's Sergio Perez being allowed to continue racing with loose bodywork. Alpine said Haas lodged their protest 24 minutes past the specified deadline.

70.title: Tottenham lacks squad depth to challenge for PL and CL: Manager Conte
70.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte said his squad lacks depth to challenge for both the Premier League and Champions League titles. "My only worry at this moment is...that we don't have (more) injuries...this (lack of depth) is not something against the club, we knew this situation," said Conte. Tottenham remains third in the Premier League, five points behind leaders Arsenal.

71.title: Will gherao Odisha CM Patnaik's residence on Oct 31: State BJP
71.article_body: The BJP has threatened to gherao Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik's residence if action is not taken in the Archana Nag blackmailing case and the killing of a BJD Zilla Parishad member. BJP said the CM's residence will be gheraoed on October 31 if the Odisha Police failed to take action in 48 hours. They have also threatened a state-wide agitation.

72.title: Leopard attacks, kills 18-month-old girl in Mumbai's Aarey Colony
72.article_body: A leopard attacked and killed an 18-month-old girl in the forested area of Mumbai's Aarey Colony on Monday. The incident happened when the child followed her mother, who was on her way to a temple about 30 feet away from her house. The girl was injured by the leopard and was declared dead after she was taken to a hospital.

73.title: 2 people killed in accidents caused by Hurricane Roslyn in Mexico
73.article_body: Two people lost their lives on Sunday in accidents caused by Hurricane Roslyn after it made landfall along Mexico's Pacific coast, authorities said. Roslyn made landfall as a Category 3 hurricane in the Mexican state of Nayarit at 5:20 am (local time), the US National Hurricane Center informed. The hurricane later weakened into a tropical storm while moving inland.

74.title: Pakistani journalist Arshad Sharif shot dead by mistake: Kenyan police
74.article_body: The killing of 50-year-old senior Pakistani journalist Arshad Sharif in Nairobi was a case of "mistaken identity", Kenyan police said. Sharif was shot and killed by police after the car he was in sped up instead of halting at a roadblock near Nairobi, police said. The police were searching for a similar car involved in a case of child abduction.

75.title: Punjab records nearly 3,700 stubble burning cases over 5 weeks
75.article_body: Punjab recorded 3,696 stubble burning incidents between September 15 and October 22 with 60% being logged in the three districts of Tarn Taran, Amritsar and Gurdaspur. Tarn Taran reported 1,034 stubble burning incidents, followed by Amritsar at 895 and Gurdaspur at 324. "Paddy harvest is complete in 35% of the total cultivated area in Punjab," said an agriculture department official.

76.title: K’taka Minister gives gold, ₹1 lakh as Diwali gift to elected representatives
76.article_body: Karnataka Tourism Minister Anand Singh's Diwali gifts to elected municipal and panchayat members in the Hospet constituency has sparked a row. The picture of the box, which contained ₹1 lakh cash, 144 gm of gold, 1 kg of silver, a silk saree, a dhoti and a dry fruit box, went viral on social media.

77.title: Pakistani journalist Arshad Sharif shot dead by police in Kenya
77.article_body: Arshad Sharif, a senior Pakistani journalist, was shot dead in Kenya when police hunting car thieves opened fire on the vehicle he was travelling in as it drove through their roadblock without stopping, according to Kenyan police. The incident took place at 10 pm on Sunday evening on the outskirts of Nairobi. Sharif's death has sparked widespread outrage in Pakistan.

78.title: 3% of Mumbai's women have hypertension, 2% have diabetes: BMC
78.article_body: A health campaign carried out by the BMC found that 3% of Mumbai's 18-plus woman population has hypertension while 2% has diabetes. In Mumbai, 2,13,177 women were screened for hypertension, while 2,05,345 were screened for diabetes. The 'Mata Surakshit Toh Ghar Surakshit' drive was to end on October 31 but has been extended to mid-November.

79.title: Snake found under bed at Telangana's MGM Hospital; video surfaces
79.article_body: A snake was found under a patient's bed in a ward of Mahatma Gandhi Memorial (MGM) Hospital in Telangana's Warangal. A video of the incident showed the snake slithering under the bed in the second such incident reported from the hospital in less than two weeks. A patient's attendant had, on October 13, found a cobra inside MGM Hospital's washroom.

80.title: Aliens do walk among us: Wasim Akram on Virat Kohli after India's win over Pakistan
80.article_body: After Virat Kohli helped India defeat Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday, former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "Aliens do walk among us, he's one of the best I've seen in the recent or modern greats." Akram added, "He has been scoring for the last 15 years, and he has the best average while chasing."

81.title: Kohli praises Ashwin for leaving ball in last over, says 'Dimag ke upar extra dimag lagaya'
81.article_body: Virat Kohli praised Ravichandran Ashwin for leaving a delivery bowled by Pakistan's Muhammad Nawaz in last over, which went on to be a wide. He said, "I told Ashwin to hit...ball over covers. But Ash...usne dimaag ke upar extra dimag lagaya. That was a brave thing for him to do...Ball came inside the line and he turned it into wide."

82.title: Inspection done at Pune Railway Station, additional staff deployed
82.article_body: After a Bihar labourer lost his life due to heavy crowds at the Pune Railway station, a detailed inspection was carried by the Pune Railway Division and the Railway Protection Force (RPF) police.  The Pune Railway Division also deployed additional manpower of RPF policemen and other railway staff at all platforms. They reviewed security arrangements and the crowd was monitored.

83.title: We are prepared to tackle incidents on Diwali: Delhi Fire Service
83.article_body: Even though it is illegal to burst firecrackers in the national capital, the Delhi Fire Service (DFS) has made all the arrangements to handle fire occurrences on Diwali. "We are prepared with drones and to access high-rise buildings. Fire tenders have been deployed near congested areas. However, we expect there will not be many fire-related incidents," chief of DFS said.

84.title: Coimbatore cylinder blast definite act of terror by fidayeen: Report
84.article_body: The cylinder blast in Coimbatore is a definite act of terror by fidayeen, reports said. Jamesha Mubin, who was killed in the cylinder blast on Sunday, had written "if the news about my death reaches you, forgive my mistakes, hide my shortcomings, participate in 'Janaasa' and pray for me" on the display of his mobile phone, reports added.

85.title: Hasan Minhaj points out his resemblance to Suryakumar in graphic shared by ICC
85.article_body: Comedian Hasan Minhaj took to Twitter to point out his resemblance to Suryakumar Yadav in a  graphic of the Indian cricketer shared by the ICC. Reacting to the cricketer's graphic, the comedian tweeted, "Pls tag me next time ICC." Several Twitter users agreed that the two resembled each other, with a user tweeting, "Separated at birth?"

86.title: Protestors throw chocolate cake on King Charles III's wax statue in UK
86.article_body: Two supporters of 'Just Stop Oil' attacked a Madame Tussauds waxwork model of King Charles III with chocolate cake in London. The protestors demanded that the UK government halts all new oil and gas licences and consent. "The science is clear. The demand is simple: just stop new oil and gas. It's a piece of cake," the protestors said.

87.title: Fitbit sued in Australia over refund policy on faulty devices
87.article_body: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) began court proceedings against Fitbit for misleading consumers about faulty devices. Fitbit has come under fire for claiming that consumers won't get refunded unless they return faulty products within 45 days of purchase, which is against Australian Consumer Law. The ACCC said that 58 consumers were allegedly misled by Fitbit.

88.title: We've been lot more nicer in this season: Bani on 'Four...' co-stars
88.article_body: Speaking about the bond between 'Four More Shots Please!' co-stars, actress Bani J has said they have been a lot "nicer" in the third season. "(We have been) a lot more of understanding," she added. "Somebody said tolerance the other day, but it's not tolerance. It's more of an understanding like...'let her be'. That kind of an understanding," Bani stated.

89.title: BJP leader Rapolu Bhaskar quits party, set to join ruling TRS
89.article_body: Ahead of the Munugode bypolls, BJP leader Rapolu Ananda Bhaskar resigned from the party and is set to join the ruling TRS on Monday. He expressed disappointment over the Centre’s decision to levy GST on handlooms and said that he appreciated CM KCR’s measures to enhance the condition of weavers in the state.

90.title: PWD proposes ₹12 crore budget to govt for Mumbai’s JJ Hospital renovation
90.article_body: The Maharashtra State Human Rights Commission (MSHRC) has directed the PWD to start repairs in Mumbai's JJ Hospital immediately. The PWD, according to a junior officer, has submitted a report to the government with a proposed budget of ₹12.66 crore. MSHRC said they have been receiving complaints about the hospital's infrastructure from resident doctors for a "long time".

91.title: People started taking me seriously after 'Four More...': Maanvi Gagroo
91.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo has said that people started taking her seriously after her series 'Four More Shots Please!'. "Till 'Four More Shots Please!' happened I was getting roles that were girl-next-door," she stated. Maanvi added that the show also helped with her social media following. "The kind of offers I'm getting now are interesting...Thankfully...I can pick and choose," she said.

92.title: Kerala HC’s special hearing on VCs’ petition against Governor order
92.article_body: The Vice-Chancellors of nine universities of Kerala, who were asked to resign by the Governor's Office, have approached the Kerala High Court. The High Court will hold a special sitting at 4 pm on Monday to consider the petition. "I have received the decision...but I will not submit my resignation...This is a fake accusation," said Kannur University VC Gopinath Ravindar.

93.title: Ugandan capital's Ebola tally reaches 14 with 9 new confirmed cases
93.article_body: Nine more people tested positive for Ebola in Uganda's capital Kampala on Sunday, the Ugandan Health Ministry said on Monday, taking the city's number of confirmed cases reported since Saturday to 14. All the patients who have tested positive were in isolation when they became symptomatic, the ministry said. The current Ebola outbreak in Uganda began in September.

94.title: French court approves €238 million Credit Suisse settlement
94.article_body: A French court approved a €238 million (₹19.37 lakh crore) settlement between Credit Suisse Group and the French financial prosecution office to settle a tax fraud and money laundering case. Under the terms of the agreement, the Swiss bank makes no admission of guilt. The settlement will see the bank pay a fine of €123 million to the state.

95.title: B'luru couple finds burglar dead in their pooja room after returning from Europe trip
95.article_body: A couple from Bengaluru who returned from a Europe trip found the dead body of a man in the puja room of their house. A CCTV camera footage shows that the burglar ate from the kitchen, took a shower and slept in the bedroom before dying by suicide. Police said he had been arrested in various house theft cases.

96.title: Opp'n claims Tripura minister’s son involved in 16-yr-old’s gangrape
96.article_body: Three people, including a woman, have been arrested for their alleged involvement in the gangrape of a 16-year-old girl in Tripura's Unakoti district. The opposition Congress and CPI(M) have claimed that a state minister's son was involved in the incident and called for his arrest. The girl was allegedly gang-raped in a three-storey building in Kumarghat on October 19.

97.title: B'luru couple finds burglar dead in their pooja room after returning from Europe trip
97.article_body: A couple from Bengaluru who returned from a Europe trip found the dead body of a man in the puja room of their house. A CCTV camera footage shows that the burglar ate from the kitchen, took a shower and slept in the bedroom before dying by suicide. Police said he had been arrested in various house theft cases.

98.title: Starlink won't be turned off even without funding: Musk to Ukrainian Vice PM
98.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk on Monday reassured Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov that his firm SpaceX "would not turn off Starlink even if [US Department of Defence] refused to provide funding". Musk was replying to media reports claiming some European Union countries may fund Starlink services in Ukraine. "Thanks Musk...This was critically important for Ukraine. We're grateful to you!" Fedorov said.

99.title: 4 pose as policemen & rob Mumbai beautician of cash, valuables worth ₹7 lakh
99.article_body: Mumbai Police on Saturday arrested three people, including a woman, who allegedly posed as police officers and barged into a beautician's house, robbing her of cash and valuables worth over ₹7 lakh. The police, during the interrogation, learned that the victim's family friend had informed the accused about the valuables, following which a plan was hatched, a police officer said.

100.title: US, UK warn of possible terror attack in Nigeria's capital Abuja
100.article_body: The US and Britain on Sunday warned their citizens in Nigeria about a possible terror attack in the country's capital, Abuja, aimed at government buildings and tourist attractions, among other targets. Nigeria has been battling an Islamist insurgency since 2009, primarily in the northeast. In July, however, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for a major prison raid in Abuja.

101.title: Mumbai gang clones debit cards, withdraws ₹6.47 lakh in 58 transactions
101.article_body: A gang in Mumbai withdrew ₹6.47 lakh through 58 transactions in three days. Using cloned debit cards, the gang withdrew ₹500 on October 4, ₹4.9 lakh in 49 transactions on October 5 and ₹70,000 in seven transactions on October 6 from an ATM in Marol. They also withdrew ₹87,000 in two transactions from an ATM in Chakala on October 5-6.

102.title: India break world record for winning most matches in int'l cricket in a calendar year
102.article_body: The last-ball four-wicket victory against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday was India's 39th victory in international cricket in 2022. With this, India broke the world record for winning the most number of matches in international cricket in a calendar year. The previous record was held by Australia, who had won 38 matches in 2003.

103.title: Fans will watch film that appeals to them: Akshay on Ram Setu-Thank God clash
103.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking about the clash between his film 'Ram Setu' and Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Thank God', has said that there is no clash. "Fans will choose to watch the one that appeals to them the most or better...watch both," he stated. Akshay added, "The main objective is for...fans to enjoy the festival at the movies with friends and family."

104.title: Delhi man dies after his parked SUV catches fire in Alipur
104.article_body: A man was burnt alive after his parked SUV caught fire in Delhi's Alipur area on Sunday. The victim has not yet been identified as only his bones remained after the fire. "The car is registered in the name of a person who lives in Kurukshetra [in Haryana]. A police team has been sent...for further inquiry," police said.

105.title: 'Kantara' beats 'KGF: Chapter 1', becomes 2nd highest-grossing Kannada film
105.article_body: Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' has earned around ₹188 crore worldwide since its release, making it the second highest-grossing Kannada film. The film went past Yash's 'KGF: Chapter 1'. However, 'KGF: Chapter 2' is still the highest-grossing Kannada film. In India, Kantara has earned ₹170.50 crore, with the film earning ₹111.25 crore in Karnataka.

106.title: Celebrate Diwali with deprived people, UP CM tells officers & employees
106.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath extended Diwali greetings on Monday and urged officers and employees to celebrate the festival with the deprived and needy people. In a tweet, CM Adityanath said that it should be our endeavour to illuminate every house with the spirit of harmony, adding that there should be 'Ramatv' all around.

107.title: North Korea and South Korea exchange warning shots near sea border
107.article_body: North and South Korea exchanged warning shots off the western coast of the Korean Peninsula on Monday. Seoul said its forces fired warning shots to repel a North Korean merchant vessel that had breached the Northern Limit Line (NLL), the de facto sea boundary between the two countries. Meanwhile, Pyongyang accused a South Korean naval ship of violating the NLL.

108.title: OTTs, social media platforms may pay access charge to telcos: Report
108.article_body: Social media platforms like WhatsApp, Facebook and Twitter, along with over-the-top (OTT) firms like Netflix, Prime Video and Disney+Hotstar, may reportedly have to pay carriage charge to telecom operators. As data grows, telecom service providers have to keep increasing their carriage capacity and backhaul networks, which requires investment. The draft Telecom Bill may adopt this regulation.

109.title: That's why they won the match: Babar on journalist's 'Kohli was the difference' remark
109.article_body: During the press conference following Pakistan's defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022, a journalist, while asking a question, remarked Virat Kohli was the difference between the two sides. Pakistan captain Babar Azam interrupted the journalist and said, "That's why they won the match." He further said that Kohli's 53-ball 82* knock will give the India batter "more confidence".

110.title: WWE's Heyman shares Kohli's pic, jokes 'He acknowledged our tribal chief Reigns'
110.article_body: WWE wrestler Roman Reigns' special counsel Paul Heyman shared a picture of Virat Kohli from celebrations following India's win against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022. He jokingly wrote, "It's with great honor that I, #SpecialCounsel and #Wiseman to #Bloodline, accept the great @imVkohli's celebration as, in front of the world, he decided to acknowledge our tribal chief @WWERomanReigns."

111.title: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's husband John Shaw passes away
111.article_body: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's husband John Shaw passed away on Monday. He was the former Vice Chairman of Biocon. John, a member of Biocon's board of directors since 1999, was a foreign promoter and on the advisory board of various Biocon group companies, according to the company's website.

112.title: Delhi was most polluted city in the world, not anymore: Kejriwal
112.article_body: After Delhi was not featured on the list of the top 10 most polluted cities of Asia, CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "Some years back, [Delhi] was the most polluted city in the world. Not anymore!" Lauding the people of the city, he added "While we have improved, there is still a long way to go".

113.title: India will always seek to strengthen UN's effectiveness: S Jaishankar
113.article_body: On the 77th anniversary of the United Nations, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar claimed that India will always seek to strengthen the UN's effectiveness. "India’s ongoing tenure as a member of the Security Council has reflected our principled approach of promoting dialogue and diplomacy to meet contemporary challenges. We will always stand with the Global South," tweeted Jaishankar.

114.title: After 'Tanhaji', I was offered to play Shivaji Maharaj many times: Sharad
114.article_body: Actor Sharad Kelkar revealed he was offered the role of Shivaji Maharaj many times after his portrayal of the character in Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Tanhaji'.  "I responded by asking 'How many films will I do with the same character?' And they said that they feel I would do justice to the character," he added. Sharad will feature in 'Har Har Mahadev'.

115.title: Multiple subways in B'luru continue to remain submerged despite no rains
115.article_body: Multiple subways in Bengaluru continued to remain filled with water despite the city witnessing no rains in the past few days. Commuters complained that many pedestrian subways, including the Nrupathunga Road and Raj Bhavan Road subways, were inaccessible due to the water. "It has been over three days. There is no action from the authorities," a resident said.

116.title: China's GDP grows by 3.9% Y-o-Y in July-September quarter
116.article_body: The GDP of China showed a 3.9% year-on-year growth in the July-September quarter, amid a raft of government measure. However, domestic demand declined towards the end of the quarter due to persistent COVID-19 restrictions, a prolonged property slump and global recession risks. In the nine months to September, China's inflation-adjusted urban per capita consumption fell 0.2% on year.

117.title: World's largest diya lit up in Punjab's Mohali; pic surfaces
117.article_body: The world's largest diya was lit up in Punjab's Mohali amid Diwali festivities. More than 10,000 people contributed 3,560 litres of oil for an event to light up the diya made with 1,000 kilograms of steel. The diya, which was recognised as the world's largest by the Guinness World Records, measures 3.37 metres in diameter.

118.title: 258 people arrested in Chhattisgarh for luring people into online betting
118.article_body: Chhattisgarh Police has arrested 258 people in 25 cases over the past month for operating centres to lure people into online betting via online application 'Mahadev'. The application was launched by group of people operating out of Dubai. "They opened around 30 centres, mostly in Chhattisgarh, and over ₹200 crores of transactions happen from each of these centres," police said.

119.title: Mumbai Police turn 'bhajiwala', 'doodhwala' to crack 30-yr-old assault case
119.article_body: Mumbai Police cracked a 30-year-old assault case and arrested a 57-year-old man for allegedly assaulting a woman in 1993. Police posed as milkmen, vegetable vendors, courier boys and postmen to nab the accused, who was taken into custody on October 20. The accused had attacked the victim with a chopper and was on the Mumbai Police's most wanted list.

120.title: 2 bodies found after plane carrying Gold's Gym owner crashed off Costa Rica
120.article_body: Two dead bodies were recovered by Costa Rican authorities on Sunday during their search for people who were on board a small plane that crashed in the Caribbean Sea on Friday. Rainer Schaller, the owner of fitness chains Gold's Gym and McFit, and five others were listed as being on the aircraft. The recovered bodies could not be identified immediately.

121.title: Jindal Group to enter lending business with ₹400 crore investment
121.article_body: Gaurav Sachdeva, the Chief Executive Officer of JSW One Platforms (JSWOP), said the JSW group will enter the lending space with an investment of up to ₹400 crore in a non-bank finance company (NBFC). The NBFC will be a subsidiary of JSWOP. Sachdeva said the NBFC can help other JSW companies like cement, steel, or paints by offering financing solutions.

122.title: Russian oil supplies to China in Sept rise 22% YoY, second to Saudi
122.article_body: Russian oil supplies to China in September 2022 rose 22% YoY while Saudi Arabia remained the top oil supplier to China. Russian supplies in September totalled 7.46 million tonnes, equivalent to 1.82 million barrels per day (bpd), data from Chinese General Administration of Customs showed. This is down from the record high of nearly 2 million bpd imported in May.

123.title: Notice asks women lawyers to not 'arrange hair in open court' in Pune; pic shared
123.article_body: Senior Supreme Court advocate Indira Jaising has shared a picture of a Pune court notice that asked women advocates to refrain from arranging their hair. "It's repeatedly noticed that women advocates are arranging their hair in open Court, which is disturbing the functioning of the Court," it read. "Wow now look! Who's distracted by women advocates and why," Jaising wrote.

124.title: Major fire breaks out at drugs manufacturing unit in Chennai
124.article_body: A major fire broke out at a private drugs manufacturing unit in Tamil Nadu's Chennai on Monday. The fire department received the information about the fire at around 8.15 am and several fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The fire engulfed the entire building and several vehicles parked near the firm were also charred.

125.title: Taskin records his career-best T20I figures as B'desh defeat Netherlands
125.article_body: Bangladesh defeated Netherlands by nine runs in their T20 World Cup Super 12 stage match on Monday. Batting first, Bangladesh posted a total of 144/8, with Afif Hossain (38 off 27) being the top-scorer for the side. Netherlands were eventually bowled out for 135 runs as Bangladesh pacer Taskin Ahmed registered his career-best T20I figures of 4-0-25-4 in the match.

126.title: People asked me, 'Hero kaun hai?' I replied 'me': Janhvi Kapoor on 'Mili'
126.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said whenever she tells people she's working on a female-oriented film, they address it "like it's an anomaly". She asked if they'd ask an actor their feeling about doing a male-oriented film if her upcoming film 'Mili' was called 'Milan'. "Many times, when I'm doing this film, I'm asked, 'Hero kaun hai?'...I answer 'Me'," she stated.

127.title: Power connection of Bhagat Singh's house never disconnected: Administration
127.article_body: The district administration of Shaheed Bhagat Singh Nagar, Punjab, rejected reports that the power connection of freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's ancestral house was disconnected. "In fact, Powercom has an advance bill payment worth ₹6,760 with them," Deputy Commissioner Navjot Singh said. He also made an appeal to the media not to use the name of Bhagat Singh's ancestral house.

128.title: At least 220 killed in tribal clashes in southern Sudan
128.article_body: At least 220 people were killed in two days of tribal fighting as of Saturday night in Sudan's southern Blue Nile province, a senior health official said on Sunday. The clashes erupted in the town of Wad el-Mahi due to a land dispute between two tribes. A 30-day state of emergency has been declared in the Blue Nile province.

129.title: Why was Karthik given out despite Rizwan collecting ball in front of wickets?
129.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik was stumped out by Pakistan wicketkeeper Muhammad Rizwan on the bowling of Muhammad Nawaz in the last over despite Rizwan collecting the ball in front of wickets. The ball wasn't called a no-ball as the ball had hit Karthik's pads before reaching Rizwan. As per MCC's Law 27.3.1, Rizwan's collection of the ball was legitimate.

130.title: Delhi LG VK Saxena, CM Arvind Kejriwal wish people on Diwali
130.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena and Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday wished happiness and prosperity to the people of the national capital on Diwali. The LG also urged everyone to follow precautionary measures for COVID-19 and pollution while celebrating the festival. Arvind Kejriwal took to Twitter and said, "May goddess Laxmi always reside in your house."

131.title: Woman steals gold worth ₹12 lakh from 54-yr-old cousin in Mumbai
131.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly stealing gold ornaments worth ₹12 lakh from her 54-year-old cousin's house in Mumbai. The accused first visited her cousin on September 24. She again visited on September 30 and used her cousin's bedroom to change clothes. The complainant noticed the absence of her ornaments on October 9, resulting in her filing a complaint.

132.title: I broke up with Julia as I was scared she'd leave me: 'Friends' star Matthew
132.article_body: 'Friends' star Matthew Perry in his forthcoming memoir revealed that he dated actress Julia Roberts for a few months. "Dating Julia Roberts had been too much for me. I'd been constantly certain that she was going to break up with me," he wrote. "So instead of facing the inevitable agony of losing her, I broke up with her," he added.

133.title: 'We all lost as a team', says Babar Azam to Pak cricket team; PCB shares video
133.article_body: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam addressed the Pakistan cricket team after it was defeated by India in the T20 World Cup match in Melbourne on Sunday. In a video shared by Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB), Azam told the team, "We all lost as a team. Nobody should point fingers at one person, this shouldn't happen, not in this team," he added.

134.title: PM participates in 'Vande Mataram' sing-along with jawans in Kargil on Diwali
134.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, who is in Kargil celebrating Diwali with Army Jawans, took part in a 'Vande Mataram' sing-along with members of the Armed Forces. PM Modi can be seen clapping and humming the song in a video, while several jawans can be seen playing musical instruments. PM landed in Kargil on Monday to celebrate Diwali with jawans.

135.title: Brazilian President's ally throws grenades at police to evade arrest, 2 officers injured
135.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro's ally Roberto Jefferson threw grenades at police officers who arrived at his residence in Rio de Janeiro to arrest him on Sunday. Two police officers were injured and taken to a hospital. A Supreme Court judge earlier ordered his detention for insulting Chief Justice Carmen Lucia. President Bolsonaro condemned the armed attack.

136.title: DRI seizes narcotics worth ₹15 cr from Mumbai airport cargo; 3 held
136.article_body: Officials of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested three persons, including a Nigerian national and seized narcotics worth ₹15 crore from the Mumbai international airport cargo. The officials recovered 1.9 kg of Amphetamine Type Substance (ATS) as tablets, which were packed in polythene packs concealed inside the body of the corrugated packaging material, an official said.

137.title: 28-yr-old punched, hit with belt by 3 for 'staring' at 1 of them in Mumbai
137.article_body: A 28-year-old man was allegedly killed by three persons following a dispute over staring at one of them in Mumbai, a police official said on Monday. The official said that the accused allegedly hit the victim on his head with a belt, punched him and also hurled abuses. The incident took place on Sunday.

138.title: College students wear 'anti-cheating' hats, masks during exams in Philippines; pics viral
138.article_body: Pictures of college students wearing 'anti-cheating' hats and masks in the Philippines have gone viral on social media. A professor of mechanical engineering at Bicol University College of Engineering shared the pictures and wrote, "Midterm Exam Moments." The students created homemade hats and masks out of cardboard, egg boxes and other recycled materials.

139.title: Met John Abraham as courier boy, it was life-defining: Harshvardhan Rane
139.article_body: Actor Harshvardhan Rane revealed he met John Abraham as a courier boy to deliver the latter a Yamaha helmet. "It was a life-defining moment...he made me comfortable. He invited me to the event for which he had flown to Delhi. He...gave me his mobile number," he added. Harshvardhan said he still doesn't have the "guts" to call John.

140.title: Dravid sir told me to be calm, I said 'Sir, I'm just happy to be here': Hardik
140.article_body: In a conversation with Virat Kohli after their win against Pakistan in the 2022 T20 World Cup, Hardik Pandya revealed that coach Rahul Dravid, when he was coming in to bat, told him to "just be calm". Hardik added, "So, I just had to tell him that, 'Sir, please understand I am just happy to be here'."

141.title: Massive fire breaks out at a house in Itanagar, causes damage worth lakhs
141.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a house in Naharlagun, a town in Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar district, resulting in "damage worth lakhs". "The fire completely burnt 15 rooms of the rented kutcha house unit...along with...important documents," said the house's owner Mena. There have been no casualties reported so far. There's no information available over the reason behind this incident.

142.title: ICC shares video of fans chanting 'Chak De India' in stadium after India beats Pak
142.article_body: ICC took to social media to share a video that showed fans at the Melbourne Cricket Ground chanting 'Chak De India' after India beat Pakistan in the T20 World Cup match. The video also showed the fans whistling and cheering for Virat Kohli, who smashed 82*(53). "Raw vision: Behind the scenes of India's sensational win," ICC captioned the video.

143.title: 34-year-old man dies of cardiac arrest while watching India-Pakistan match in Assam
143.article_body: A 34-year-old man identified as Bitu Gogoi passed away after suffering cardiac arrest while watching India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match in Assam's Sivasagar district. Bitu was watching the match at a local cinema hall with his friends when he suddenly became unconscious and fell down. He was rushed to a local hospital, where the doctors declared him brought dead.

144.title: Philips announces 4,000 job cuts, CEO says 'difficult, but necessary decision'
144.article_body: Dutch medical equipment maker Philips announced 4,000 job cuts following a massive recall of respiratory machines that slashed around 70% off its market value in the past year. Philips CEO Roy Jakobs called the decision "difficult, but necessary". "My immediate priority is to improve execution so that we can start rebuilding the trust of patients, consumers and customers," he added.

145.title: HC quashes case against boy who accidentally crashed cycle into old woman
145.article_body: The Bombay High Court quashed a case that had been filed against a 10-year-old boy, who had accidentally caused injuries to a 62-year-old woman by crashing into her while cycling. It also ordered the state government to provide compensation of ₹25,000 to the boy and his mother. The  amount will be recovered from the police officers involved in the case.

146.title: Akshay's 'Ram Setu' is convergence of science, history, Ramayana: Director
146.article_body: Director Abhishek Sharma said Akshay Kumar's 'Ram Setu' is a convergence of science, history, geography and Ramayana. As per the film's producer Vikram Malhotra, Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi "played an important part in bridging the areas of history and spirituality with his extensive research over decades". Dr Dwivedi, who directed Akshay's 'Samrat Prithviraj', was brought in as a creative producer.

147.title: 4-year-old shot dead in Agra, father's friend held
147.article_body: A four-year-old boy was kidnapped and later shot dead allegedly by his father's friend in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. According to reports, the accused tried to mislead the family of the victim by helping in search for the boy and recovering the body. The weapon used has been recovered but the motive is yet to be ascertained, said police.

148.title: Sudarsan Pattnaik sculpts Goddess Kali's sand art with 4,045 diyas
148.article_body: Renowned sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik has created a 5-foot-high sand art of Goddess Kali by using 4,045 diyas with the message, "Let us burn out all the negativity," at the Puri beach in Odisha. "This Diwali, I want to appeal to people to keep our environment clean and pollution free," said Pattnaik.

149.title: Cong criticises K'taka govt for spending ₹4.5 crore on a promotional video
149.article_body: The Karnataka Congress criticised the state government for spending around ₹4.5 crore on a 5-minute video to promote the upcoming Global Investors Meet (GIM) in Bengaluru. Congress MLA Priyank Kharge said that the government, which has failed to provide jobs, is spending an exorbitant amount on promotion. The Global Investors Meet is scheduled from November 2 to November 4.

150.title: 25-yr-old journalist dies after falling into under-construction stormwater drain in Chennai
150.article_body: A 25-year-old journalist working with a private news channel in Tamil Nadu's Chennai died after falling into an under-construction stormwater drain while returning home from work. He apparently tried to leap over the trench. He was taken to VH hospital and later shifted to Government Royapettah Hospital, where he succumbed to the injuries.

151.title: Rohit Sharma mimics journalist during presser after win vs Pakistan, video goes viral
151.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma mimicked a journalist during the press conference following last-ball win against Pakistan. A video of the same has gone viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen answering in the journalist's accent. "I felt really good, I felt really good," Rohit said while mimicking. People present at the press conference were then heard laughing.

152.title: Video of Melbourne Cricket Ground echoing with Indian National Anthem goes viral
152.article_body: A video has gone viral showing thousands of Indian fans singing the National Anthem ahead of India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. The official Twitter handle of the Mumbai Police shared a video taken by a fan, writing, "The country and anthem we all rise up for." More than 90,000 spectators attended the match.

153.title: Governor seeking VCs' resignations is undemocratic: Kerala CM Vijayan
153.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has termed state Governor Arif Mohammed Khan seeking resignations of Vice-Chancellors of nine universities in the state as "undemocratic". Vijayan added, "Governor's post is not to move against the government, but to uphold constitution's dignity. He's acting as a tool of RSS." Governor Arif had directed VCs to send him resignations by 11.30 am on Monday.

154.title: Apple CEO shares Diwali pic clicked by Mumbai photographer, calls it 'beautiful'
154.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook on Monday shared a picture clicked by Mumbai-based photographer Apeksha Maker. "This photo beautifully captures why Diwali is known as the Festival of Lights. Wishing all who celebrate a holiday full of joy and prosperity," he tweeted. The photographer said she was "humbled" to see Cook share the image.

155.title: 5 family members killed as car rams into truck in UP's Basti
155.article_body: Five members of a family were killed after their car rammed into a container truck in UP's Basti district on Sunday. The victims include a 60-year-old man called Sanjeev Kumar, a 40-year-old woman named Ankita, his 17-year-old son and 14-year-old daughter. Another 40-year-old woman died in the accident. The family was travelling to UP's Sant Kabir Nagar district from Lucknow.

156.title: Prabhas fans cause fire at theatre after bursting firecrackers on his b'day
156.article_body: A fire broke out at Venkatramana theatre in Andhra Pradesh after fans of actor Prabhas burst firecrackers during the screening of the 2009 film 'Billa' on the occasion of the actor's birthday. The seats in the theatre caught fire, however, it was put out by theatre employees and movie watchers. No casualties were reported from the incident.

157.title: Minor boy tied to pole & beaten up on suspicion of theft in UP; video surfaces
157.article_body: Three men tied a minor boy to a pole and thrashed him on the suspicion of theft in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh district. A video of the incident shows one of the men tying the boy's hands and legs. The Azamgarh Police said it has arrested all three accused, who are aged 32, 45, and 52 years.

158.title: Can't have better Diwali than being with you: PM to soldiers in Kargil
158.article_body: PM Narendra Modi reached Jammu and Kashmir's Kargil to celebrate Diwali with jawans on Monday. "I cannot have a better Diwali than being with you," he said, adding that Diwali means "festival of end of terror" and Kargil has made it possible. "A country is actually proud when its soldiers' heads are as high as the Himalayas," PM Modi added.

159.title: Cyclone 'Sitrang' to intensify into severe cyclonic storm by tonight
159.article_body: Cyclone 'Sitrang' is very likely to intensify into a severe cyclonic storm in next 12 hours and continue its movement, the India Meteorological Department said on Monday. It is likely to cross Bangladesh coast between Tinkona Island and Sandwip early Tuesday. North coastal Odisha is expected to receive heavy rainfall, while heavy to very heavy rainfall is expected over Bengal.

160.title: It was redemption for him in one way: Jaffer on Arshdeep's 3/32 vs Pak
160.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has praised India pacer Arshdeep Singh for registering figures of 3/32 against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup match. "It was redemption for him (Arshdeep) in one way," said Jaffer. Arshdeep had faced online abuse for dropping Asif Ali's catch in India's defeat against Pakistan in their Asia Cup Super 4 match last month.

161.title: 26,000 people visit Byculla Zoo over Diwali weekend, generates ₹10L
161.article_body: A revenue of ₹10 lakh was generated after 26,000 people visited the Byculla Zoo in Mumbai over the Diwali weekend. "Almost 18,000 visitors were recorded on Sunday," said the zoo director Dr Sanjay Tripathi. The zoo has undergone a revamp over the last few years with new exotic animals brought from different places to enhance the experience.

162.title: 25-yr-old Mumbai businessman jailed after pulling 16-yr-old's hair, calling her 'item'
162.article_body: A 25-year-old Mumbai businessman has been sentenced to 1.5 years in jail for harassing a 16-year-old school student. The man in 2015 had pulled the girl's hair and told her, "Kya item, kidhar ja rahi ho?" The POCSO court ruled that the word "item" to address a girl is used in the context of objectifying her sexually and nothing else.

163.title: ICC shares video of Ashwin hitting match-winning run, Dravid's reaction goes viral
163.article_body: The ICC has shared a video of India's Ravichandran Ashwin hitting the match-winning run against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022. The video shows reactions of Indian players and support staff from the dugout. Team India head coach Rahul Dravid's animated reaction has gone viral. "If Rahul Dravid is celebrating...it means it's really special," a fan commented on Instagram.

164.title: Google CEO Pichai celebrates India's win over Pak, responds to troll on Twitter
164.article_body: Google and Alphabet's CEO Sundar Pichai on Monday tweeted, "Happy Diwali!...I celebrated by watching the last three overs again today, what a game and performance #Diwali #TeamIndia #T20WC2022." When a troll tweeted, "You should watch 1st three overs," Pichai responded by tweeting, "Did that too...what a spell from Bhuvi and Arshdeep." India beat Pakistan by 4 wickets on Sunday.

165.title: BCCI shares video of Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya's interaction after Pakistan match
165.article_body: The BCCI has shared a video of Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya's interaction after India's last-ball victory against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022. In the video, Pandya can be heard telling Kohli, "I would have taken a bullet for you, but I wouldn't have let you get out." Kohli and Pandya shared a 113-run stand for the fifth wicket.

166.title: Russian fighter jet crashes into house in Russia as both pilots 'suffocate in cockpit'
166.article_body: A Su-30 Russian warplane crashed into a house in Russia on Sunday, killing two people. The casualties were believed to be the pilots as earlier reports suggest they had suffocated in the cockpit during the test flight. The plane fell nose-first into a suburb of Irkutsk city. Three children were said to have been evacuated from the building.

167.title: Invite from The White House has come as true surprise: Karsh Kale
167.article_body: Indian-American music composer Karsh Kale has reacted to being invited to The White House for Diwali celebrations. "After three challenging years of the pandemic, this invite has come as a true surprise," he stated. This is the second time Karsh has been invited to The White House. He was first invited in 2013 under the tenure of ex-President Barack Obama.

168.title: Virat Kohli, the name is enough: Wahab Riaz on Kohli's innings vs Pakistan
168.article_body: Pakistan pacer Wahab Riaz said the India-Pakistan match in the T20 World Cup on Sunday was "intense" and the "better team won". Riaz also praised Virat Kohli for his match-winning innings, tweeting, "Kohli, naam hi kaaafii haa, (Kohli, the name is enough)." Former Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez also praised Kohli, tweeting, "It was special innings from a very special player."

169.title: To my B'wood friends: Kangana on 'If I hurt you, you deserve it' meme
169.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, actress Kangana Ranaut shared a meme, which read, "To anybody, I hurt this year, you deserve it." Along with the meme, the actress wrote, "Now that the year is ending, I want to confess something similar to my Bollywood friends." Kangana, who recently starred in 'Dhaakad', will feature in 'Emergency'.

170.title: 20 wagons of coal-laden goods train derail in Maharashtra; multiple trains cancelled
170.article_body: As many as 20 wagons of a coal-laden goods train derailed in Maharashtra's Amravati district late Sunday night. There was no report of any casualty in the incident that took place between Malkhed and Timtala stations. After the derailment, several passenger trains have been cancelled or diverted, railway officials said on Monday.

171.title: India reports 1,334 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 23,193
171.article_body: India reported 1,334 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,994 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases now stand at 23,193. The data showed that 1,557 people recovered in the last 24 hours. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,977.

172.title: Two people arrested for sale of illegal firecrackers in Noida
172.article_body: In two separate raids, Gautam Buddha Nagar Police arrested two people for storage and sale of illegal firecrackers. Huge quantity of firecrackers was seized from both the suspects. Cases have been registered against them under various Sections of the Explosives Act. "Police will take strict action if any offenders are caught," said Gautam Buddha Nagar's District Magistrate.

173.title: I'll not do it: Kannur University VC on Kerala Governor seeking resignation
173.article_body: After Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan sought resignations of Vice-Chancellors of nine universities in the state, Kannur University Vice-Chancellor Dr Gopinath Ravindran, who's among the nine VCs, said he'll not resign. "A VC's resignation is based on financial irregularities and bad behaviour, neither of which has happened," he said. Kerala Education Minister has criticised Governor's move.

174.title: Delhi Police arrest 29 people for gambling, seize ₹58 lakh
174.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 29 people, including 7 women, for gambling at a hotel in the Punjabi Bagh area on Sunday. They also recovered over ₹58 lakh and 10 sets of playing cards. "On October 22, specific inputs were received that a large number of people were assembling at the hotel for...gambling at the banquet hall," said DCP Ghanshyam Bansal.

175.title: Saw a tear in Virat's eyes, this was unforgettable: Harsha Bhogle on India's win over Pak
175.article_body: Following Virat Kohli's match-winning knock of 82*(53) against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "I've seen Virat for so many years.
