I've never seen a tear in his eyes. I saw it today. This was unforgettable." Kohli broke down after helping India beat Pakistan. India scored 16 runs in last over to win the match.

176.title: What records did Virat Kohli break in match against Pakistan?
176.article_body: With his 82*(53) against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday, Virat Kohli became the leading run-scorer in T20I cricket with 3,794 runs. With 24 fifty-plus scores, Kohli broke Sachin Tendulkar's record for recording most 50-plus scores in ICC events. Kohli also broke the record for winning most Player of the Match (POTM) awards in T20Is, with 14 awards.

177.title: Govt releases pic of PM Modi in Kargil to celebrate Diwali
177.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday arrived in Kargil to celebrate Diwali. The Prime Minister's Office released a picture of PM Modi in the region and tweeted, "Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has landed in Kargil, where he will celebrate Diwali with our brave soldiers." PM Modi has been celebrating Diwali with Indian Army soldiers since 2014.

178.title: 11-yr-old activist's phone snatched while shooting live video; Noida Police responds
178.article_body: Environmental activist Licypriya Kangujam's phone was snatched in Greater Noida's Sector 16B on Sunday while she was going live on Facebook, the 11-year-old tweeted. Responding to her tweet, DCP Central Noida said, "Police station in-charge Bisrakh has been directed to take necessary action...FIR has been registered at police station Bisrakh, necessary legal action is being taken in advance."

179.title: Begin your revolutionary 5G journey with Airtel 5G Plus: Airtel
179.article_body: Airtel announced that its 5G Plus services will be available in 8 cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai and more in a phased manner. The brand has been at the forefront of 5G innovation, offering 30 times higher speed with super-fast call connect, it said, adding that the Airtel 4G SIMs offers 5G services on all 5G smartphones.

180.title: Want to come back here again: Ram Charan on RRR's response in Japan
180.article_body: Actor Ram Charan, who has been in Japan promoting his film 'RRR', has said that he wants to come back to the country again. "I can see so many emotions in this room, which is making me emotional. This is so heartwarming...appreciative. I can never forget this moment," he added. 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli was also present in the auditorium.

181.title: Rohit Sharma shares pics from India-Pakistan match, says 'Great night at the G'
181.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma took to Instagram to share pictures from India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match, which took place at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday. "Great night at the G," he captioned his post. Commenting on his post, a fan wrote, "Your and Virat's hug was the moment of the match."

182.title: Many think there's cold war between Rohit, Virat but it's not like that: Jaffer
182.article_body: Talking about the viral pic of India captain Rohit Sharma lifting Virat Kohli after their T20 World Cup match against Pakistan, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said, "It was a good moment." Jaffer added, "Many fans think there's some cold war going on between Rohit and Virat but it's nothing like that." Kohli scored 82*(53) to help India defeat Pakistan.

183.title: 'Ghabrana nahi hai' is not working: Saeed Ajmal after Pakistan's loss to India
183.article_body: Taking an apparent dig at Pakistan captain Babar Azam following their defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022, former Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal tweeted, "'Ghabrana nahi hai' is not working." The term 'Ghabrana nahi hai' has been known to have been used by Babar to encourage his players. Pakistan lost the match on the last ball.

184.title: Delhi's air quality moves towards 'very poor' category on Diwali morning
184.article_body: The air quality in Delhi on Diwali morning moved towards 'very poor' category amid a drop in temperature and wind speed. The Air Quality Index (AQI) stood at 298 at 6 am on Monday. Forecasting agency SAFAR earlier predicted that the air quality may plunge to 'severe' levels on the night of Diwali if people burst firecrackers like last year.

185.title: Ex-UK PM Boris Johnson pulls out of Prime Ministerial race
185.article_body: Ex-UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced his decision to pull out of the race to replace Liz Truss as the nation's Prime Minister. "There's a very good chance that I'd be successful in the election...But in the course of the last [few] days, I've sadly come to the conclusion that this would...not be the right thing to do," added Johnson.

186.title: PM Modi, President Murmu wish people on Diwali
186.article_body: PM Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu greeted people on the occasion of Diwali on Monday. "Diwali is associated with brightness and radiance. May this auspicious festival further the spirit of joy and well-being in our lives," PM Modi said. "On this great festival, I pray for happiness and prosperity in the lives of all Indians," President Murmu tweeted.

187.title: Rahul Dravid hugs Virat Kohli after his match-winning knock vs Pakistan, pic goes viral
187.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid hugged Virat Kohli after the latter scored 82*(53) to help India defeat Pakistan on the last ball in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. A picture of the same has gone viral on social media. "Two legends in one frame," a fan commented on the picture. "Very emotional," wrote another.

188.title: Warning issued to 8 states as cyclonic storm 'Sitrang' approaches
188.article_body: As the deep depression developing in the Bay of Bengal intensified into cyclonic storm 'Sitrang', the IMD has issued red and orange alerts for eight states. 'Red alert' has been issued for Tripura, Assam, Mizoram, Manipur and Nagaland while 'orange alert' has been issued for Arunachal Pradesh and West Bengal. The cyclone will reach West Bengal-Bangladesh coast on Tuesday.

189.title: Pune Police use mild force as people block traffic after India's win over Pak
189.article_body: Pune Police used mild lathicharge to control the unruly crowd that gathered to celebrate India's win over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup. "Many of them started bursting firecrackers. The crowd then came onto the road and blocked the traffic. The firecrackers were being burst in a dangerous manner," police said. Police also extinguished a large garland firecracker with water.

190.title: Bengaluru to witness partial solar eclipse for 45 minutes tomorrow
190.article_body: Residents of Bengaluru will be able to witness a partial solar eclipse for around 45 minutes on October 25. Beginning at 5:15 pm on Tuesday, the eclipse will last till sunset at about 6:00 pm and will be at its maximum at around 5:49 pm. Jawaharlal Nehru Planetarium officials have asked residents to avoid watching the eclipse with naked eyes.

191.title: Activists throw mashed potatoes at $110 mn Monet painting in Germany, release video
191.article_body: A video has shown climate activists throwing mashed potatoes at a Monet painting at a German art gallery, weeks after activists doused a Van Gogh artwork with tomato soup in the UK. Two activists from Letzte Generation (Last Generation) vandalised French painter Claude Monet's Haystacks, which sold for $110 million (around ₹907 crore) in 2019, to protest a climate catastrophe.

192.title: Verstappen beats Hamilton to win US Grand Prix, Red Bull takes constructors' title
192.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen won the United States Grand Prix on Sunday, while his Red Bull team secured the Formula One constructors' world championship a day after the death of their billionaire owner Dietrich Mateschitz. Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton finished second in the race, followed by Charles Leclerc (Ferrari), Sergio Perez (Red Bull Racing) and George Russell (Mercedes).

193.title: Unbelievable game, India vs Pakistan is always more than a game, it's an emotion: Yuvraj
193.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Yuvraj Singh called India's match against Pakistan at T20 World Cup 2022 an "unbelievable" one. He tweeted, "India vs Pakistan is always more than a game...it's an emotion!"  Meanwhile, Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne tweeted, "This game is unbelievable!!!" and Dale Steyn wrote, "This game is ridiculous!" India defeated Pakistan on last ball, scoring 16 runs in last over.

194.title: Formula One pays tribute to late Red Bull owner Dietrich Mateschitz at American Grand Prix
194.article_body: Formula One paid tribute to late Red Bull and Red Bull Racing owner Dietrich Mateschitz at American Grand Prix on Sunday. Drivers, teams and fans came together for a minute’s applause to celebrate life of Mateschitz, who died on Saturday. "He was a man who inspired so much...he's the reason...we're here,” Red Bull Racing Team Principal Christian Horner said.

195.title: A jaw-clenching match until the very end: Suresh Raina on India-Pakistan T20 WC match
195.article_body: Talking about India's four-wicket win over Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 opener in Melbourne, Suresh Raina tweeted, "It has been a jaw-clenching match until the very end, a complete turn of tables bringing victory to Team India." He added, "The energy and fighting spirit showcased by all the players was brilliant. Congratulations on your outstanding win boys!"

196.title: Richard Gould named new England and Wales Cricket Board chief executive
196.article_body: Richard Gould has been named the new chief executive of the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB). Gould will begin his new role in January. The son of the former Wales football manager Bobby Gould, he is currently working in football as chief executive at Bristol City Football Club. He has earlier served as chief executive at Somerset and Surrey.

197.title: Turning back time, the chase master Virat Kohli is back: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah
197.article_body: After Virat Kohli slammed 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday, BCCI Secretary Jay Shah tweeted, "Turning back time! The chase master Virat Kohli is back and what a match to showcase his skills." He added, "What a game we have witnessed today!" India won the match on the last ball.

198.title: Aman Sehrawat becomes first-ever Indian wrestler to win gold at U-23 World Championships
198.article_body: Aman Sehrawat created history by becoming the first-ever Indian wrestler to win a gold medal at U-23 World Wrestling Championships in Spain's Pontevedra. The 18-year-old defeated Ahmet Duman of Turkey 12-4 in the 57-kg category final. Aman was the lone Indian male freestyle wrestler to get a visa and compete in the tournament.

199.title: What an emotional game tonight: Yuzvendra Chahal on India's win against Pakistan
199.article_body: Reacting to India's last-ball victory against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, Yuzvendra Chahal tweeted, "What an emotional game tonight. The pride we play for." He added, "A stunner of a performance by Virat Kohli. We march on together." Chahal didn't feature in the playing XI against Pakistan. India will next face Netherlands on Thursday.

200.title: Ronaldinho wishes Pelé on his 82nd birthday, shares pic
200.article_body: Former Brazilian footballer Ronaldinho took to Twitter to wish Pelé on his 82nd birthday on Sunday. Sharing a picture, he wrote, "Today is the day of the greatest of all...the KING! Happy birthday Pelé...Thank you for so many joys that you gave to all of us!! Long live the king."

201.title: This is why I love this sport: Rashid Khan on India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match
201.article_body: Reacting to India winning their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against Pakistan on the last ball, Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan tweeted, "This is why I love this sport." He added, "What an exciting game of cricket between two great teams. Top performance Virat Kohli bhai." India scored 16 runs in the last over to win the match.

202.title: When the kingdom falls, the king rises: Amit Mishra on Virat Kohli
202.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli smashing 82*(53) against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, veteran spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "When the kingdom falls, the king rises...Take a bow King Kohli." Kohli's knock helped India defeat Pakistan by four wickets. India chased down the 160-run target on the last ball. Kohli slammed six fours and four sixes in the match.

203.title: Babar Azam gives speech in dressing room after defeat against India, PCB shares video
203.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam gave a speech in the dressing room after defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022. Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) shared a video on Instagram. In the video, Babar can be heard telling players, "We should not fall." He also encouraged Muhammad Nawaz, who gave away 16 runs in the last over against India.

204.title: I think I am a showman: Hardik Pandya after win against Pakistan in T20 World Cup
204.article_body: Following India's victory against Pakistan, all-rounder Hardik Pandya said, "I think I'm a showman. I will not come everyday but when I come I’ll put on a show." He added, "That’s why I messaged my wife and a few closest people and said, 'I don’t know, I just had a gut feeling that tonight is gonna be a special night'."

205.title: We know what Shaheen delivers but he wasn’t really there: Waqar on match against India
205.article_body: Following Pakistan's defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday, former Pakistan captain Waqar Younis said, "We know what Shaheen Afridi delivers but he wasn’t really there." He stated that Shaheen lacked match practice, adding that he should have played in New Zealand ahead of the T20 World Cup. Shaheen Afridi went wicketless in the match.

206.title: Sourav Ganguly pulls out of the race to become the CAB's next chief
206.article_body: Former BCCI President Sourav Ganguly on Sunday pulled out of the race to become the Cricket Association of Bengal's next chief. Ganguly said, "I would've been elected uncontested, but I don't think it's right. Others wouldn't have got the opportunity to work for this association. They will be working for these three years now and we will see after that."

207.title: That was incredibly special, my friend: De Villiers to Kohli on his 82*(53) vs Pakistan
207.article_body: Praising his former RCB teammate Virat Kohli for his 82*(53) against Pakistan in India's T20 World Cup 2022 opener, former South Africa captain AB de Villiers tweeted, "Virat, that was incredibly special my friend!" He added, "The best of the best." Kohli smashed six fours and four sixes in his innings. India beat Pakistan by four wickets.

208.title: India bags a well fought win, special mention to Kohli for a spectacular innings: PM
208.article_body: Reacting to India's victory against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 opener on Sunday, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "The India team bags a well fought victory!" He added, "Congratulations for an outstanding performance today. A special mention to Virat Kohli for a spectacular innings in which he demonstrated remarkable tenacity. Best wishes for the games ahead."

209.title: Telangana logs 69 fresh COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
209.article_body: Telangana recorded 69 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the state government informed on Sunday, taking the state's total case tally to 8,39,640. Hyderabad reported 43 cases, the highest among all districts in the state. No new deaths due to the infection were reported. Telangana's active case count now stands at 542.

210.title: Bagnaia wins Malaysian GP to extend MotoGP title lead by 23 points
210.article_body: Ducati rider Francesco Bagnaia won the Malaysian Grand Prix to consolidate his lead at the top of the MotoGP board with one race left in the season. Bagnaia has a 23-point lead over Yamaha's Fabio Quartararo, who finished the GP in third place. "I did the best start I ever did in my life. It was perfect," said Bagnaia.

211.title: Use technology, why flare things unnecessarily: Akram on no-ball call in India's last over
211.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said the umpires should have used technology and consulted third umpire to check the waist-high no-ball signalled against Pakistan in India's last over. "To naked eye, it did not seem like a no-ball but in slow-motion, it does seem like it dipped," he added. He stated, "You have technology. Use it. Why flare up things unnecessarily?"

212.title: ISRO acquires land for new rocket launch site in Tamil Nadu
212.article_body: ISRO has acquired land for a proposed new rocket launch site in Tamil Nadu where a launch pad would be set up. "The design for the launch pad is ready. Once the land comes into our control...we will commence construction," said ISRO chairman S Somanath. The land is at Kulasekarapatnam in Thoothukudi district, about 650 km from Sriharikota.

213.title: Red alert issued for Assam, Meghalaya after heavy rains predicted
213.article_body: The meteorological department has issued red alerts for Assam and Meghalaya predicting heavy rainfall for three days starting Monday. Due to a depression over the Bay of Bengal, all states in the region will witness, heavy, very heavy and extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places. IMD said the depression "is very likely" to intensify into a cyclonic storm.

214.title: Kim Jong-un congratulates Xi Jinping for re-election as head of CCP
214.article_body: North Korea's leader Kim Jong-un sent a congratulatory letter to Chinese President Xi Jinping upon the latter's re-election as the Chinese Communist Party's (CCP) General secretary, North Korean state media reported. In his message, Kim Jong-un asserted that he would work alongside Xi so that the two leaders can continue to "powerfully propel the socialist cause" in their respective countries.

215.title: Should this be probed: Ali Zafar on waist-high no-ball in India's last over vs Pak
215.article_body: After former Australia spinner Brad Hogg questioned as to why the waist-high no-ball against Pakistan in India's last over was not reviewed, actor-singer Ali Zafar tweeted, "Hmm...This should be probed? I don’t know. What do the experts and the rules say?" He added, "Because that ball was the #turningpoint and @babarazam258 could be seen protesting with the umpires right after."

216.title: We've performed under pressure in past: Stoinis after loss to NZ
216.article_body: After losing to New Zealand by 89 runs on Saturday, Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis said that the team knows that they performed under pressure in the past. "There was a bit of hurt in the change room after that [loss]...It's the first game of the WC and if we look after the rest then everything should be fine," Stoinis said.

217.title: Red Bull won 2021 world championship exploiting grey areas: Alonso
217.article_body: Alpine F1's Fernando Alonso said Red Bull exploited "grey areas" to win the 2021 world championship. "This has always been part of F1...people who won the championships...exploiting that grey area," said Alonso. He said Red Bull won't lose the title over their cost cap breach as "nothing happened" when Ferrari won "two races in 2019" with a "not legal" car.

218.title: I spoke to Anushka, she was over the moon: Virat Kohli after India's win vs Pakistan
218.article_body: Following India's win against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, Virat Kohli said, "I spoke to my wife Anushka, she was over the moon." He added, "She just told me one thing, 'People are so happy. They are calling me to express their happiness'." Kohli slammed an unbeaten 82 off 53 deliveries to help India beat Pakistan.

219.title: Twitter user attributes fake quote regarding India-Pak match to Nasser, he responds
219.article_body: A Twitter user attributed a fake quote regarding India-Pakistan match to former England captain Nasser Hussain. The user claimed Nasser said that "umpires made some weird decision in favour of India". Nasser responded, "Probably best if you can delete this please...it's fake news and a fake quote and definitely not what a great game of cricket like todays deserves!"

220.title: Well done to the king and the rockstar: Karthik on Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya
220.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik penned a note after India defeated Pakistan on last ball in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday. "Well done to the king and the rockstar," he wrote for Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya. He added, "Some moments are etched in life, this was one of them for me. Just privileged...to have been a part of this game."

221.title: Why were India awarded 3 byes after Virat Kohli was bowled off free hit vs Pakistan?
221.article_body: India were awarded three byes when Virat Kohli and Dinesh Karthik ran three runs after Kohli was bowled off free hit in last over against Pakistan. It wasn't a dead ball because on a free hit, a batter can get out only in four ways, which doesn't include bowled. India were awarded the runs as ball was still in play.

222.title: West Bengal logs 75 COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
222.article_body: West Bengal recorded 75 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.36% in the last 24 hours, the state health department said on Sunday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the state. West Bengal's active case count now stands at 3,504, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

223.title: Plan was to form partnership, bat deep: Hardik after win over Pak
223.article_body: After stitching a partnership of 113 runs with Virat Kohli against Pakistan, all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that the plan was to form a partnership and bat deep. "We did not have the option of going for big shots as we were four down. We had the belief we could win...I would like to thank everyone who supported me," Hardik said.

224.title: Delhi cracker ban shows Kejriwal is 'anti-religion': Gujarat BJP
224.article_body: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil has called Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal "anti-religious" for his government's decision to ban firecrackers in the national capital. Paatil said Kejriwal and AAP were trying to come to power in Gujarat and asked the gathering he was addressing how they will "burst firecrackers". AAP has said the ban is based on a Supreme Court order.

225.title: Kidnapped 16-yr-old Dalit girl found dead after 4 days in MP
225.article_body: A 16-year-old Dalit girl, who was allegedly kidnapped from her village four days back, was found dead in a field in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district on Sunday. The exact cause of the girl's death is yet to be known, police said. The class 11 student was allegedly kidnapped when she was returning from school on October 19.

226.title: 30 injured after UP-bound bus carrying labourers overturns in MP
226.article_body: At least 30 passengers were injured after a private bus carrying migrant labourers to Uttar Pradesh for Diwali overturned on Sunday in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district, an official said. The bus was coming from Gujarat's Surat, the official added. This comes after 15 people died and 40 others were injured when an UP-bound bus met with an accident on Friday.

227.title: 'Doctor G' is based on true events: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana
227.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said his film 'Doctor G' is based on true events. "All of us have seen it a lot of times, even in the news, how doctors are beaten up for no reason...they're just doing their jobs," he stated. "So that is also being shown in the film," the actor added. 'Doctor G' also featured Rakul Preet Singh.

228.title: Southampton hold PL league leaders Arsenal to 1-1 draw at home
228.article_body: Premier League leaders Arsenal were held to a 1-1 draw by Southampton at the Saint Mary's Stadium. Granit Xhaka scored an early goal for Arsenal as Stuart Armstrong netted a second-half equaliser for the home side. This moves Arsenal to 28 points from 11 games, two ahead of Manchester City, while Southampton are 15th with 12 points from 12 games.

229.title: No one doubts Max Verstappen won 2021 F1 world championship: Vettel
229.article_body: Aston Martin F1 driver Sebastian Vettel said "nobody doubts" that Red Bull's Max Verstappen was the 2021 world champion. Vettel said it would be "stupid" to deduct championship points from Verstappen as punishment for Red Bull breaching the cost cap. "The FIA should come out and make it, very clear, very quick or very soon," said Vettel.

230.title: Kashmir is a safe and peaceful place: Iranian diplomat
230.article_body: While speaking at a conference organised by the J&K People's Justice Front, Iranian Embassy's Cultural Counsellor Dr Muhammad Ali Rabbani on Sunday said that Kashmir is a safe and peaceful place. The conference was organised to highlight the common cultural and heritage relations between India and Iran. Rabbani also lauded India's religious harmony. He also urged Iranians to visit Kashmir.

231.title: 12 arrested for killing elephant calf in Chhattisgarh's Korba
231.article_body: Chhattisgarh forest authorities have arrested 12 persons and detained a minor boy for allegedly killing an elephant calf and burying the carcass in Korba. The accused spotted the calf on October 18 and allegedly poisoned it the next day. Later, a herd of 44 elephants to which the calf belonged went on a rampage and killed a man.

232.title: For you 'Saat khoon maaf': Javed Akhtar to Virat Kohli over his 82*(53) against Pakistan
232.article_body: Lyricist Javed Akhtar took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli for his 82*(53) that helped India defeat Pakistan by four wickets in T20 World Cup 2022. "Virat tum ko saat khoon maaf. Thank you so much. Jeetay raho," he wrote. Meanwhile, Jasprit Bumrah wrote, "A match for the ages! A match that’ll go down in the history books...Well done India."

233.title: Wouldn’t have preferred anyone else with me out there: Hardik on stand with Kohli vs Pak
233.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya penned a note on Instagram after India defeated Pakistan by four wickets in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. Hardik, who shared a 113-run stand with Kohli, wrote, "At a loss for words...Wouldn’t have preferred anyone else with me out there...One of the best games of my life."

234.title: IMD releases predicted path of cyclone 'Sitrang' in the Bay of Bengal
234.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has shared a picture showing the observed and forecast track of cyclonic storm 'Sitrang'. The deep depression developing in the Bay of Bengal had intensified into a cyclone at 5.30 pm on Sunday, the IMD said. The cyclone will cross the Bangladesh coast between Tinkona Island and Sandwip around October 25 (Tuesday), it added.

235.title: 5 people, including 4 teenage girls, drown in river in Bihar
235.article_body: Four teenage girls and a 40-year-old man drowned in the Punpun River in Hamidnagar village in Bihar's Aurangabad district on Sunday. The incident took place when the four girls aged between 13 and 15 years went to wash their clothes, an official said. Professional divers have been deployed to fish out the bodies, he added.

236.title: Iran's atomic energy agency says info leaked online following hack
236.article_body: Iran's atomic energy agency said that an e-mail server belonging to one of its subsidiaries had been hacked from abroad and information published online, state media reported on Sunday. On Saturday, Iranian hacking group Black Reward said that it had released hacked information relating to Iranian nuclear activities, saying it was done to express solidarity with the ongoing anti-hijab protests.

237.title: Had 'God syndrome' after 'Vicky Donor', felt like I'd arrived: Ayushmann
237.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has said that he developed "God syndrome" after his debut film. "I felt like I had arrived. I think it happens when you get so much...success unexpectedly and you get the 'God syndrome'. However, I have seen several ups and downs in my life," he stated. Ayushmann made his debut with the 2012 film 'Vicky Donor'.

238.title: Punjab Speaker to give ₹1 lakh to panchayats not burning stubble
238.article_body: Punjab Speaker Kultar Singh Sandhwan on Sunday announced that he will give ₹1 lakh to every panchayat if farmers in that village abstain from burning stubble. This amount will be given from his discretionary quota, according to an official statement. "As people [are] getting aware about the harmful effects of stubble burning, they are abandoning this trend," Sandhwan said.

239.title: Man Utd must end relationship with Cristiano Ronaldo: Gary Neville
239.article_body: Former Manchester United captain Gary Neville said the club should "end" its relationship with forward Cristiano Ronaldo. "End it (the contract) this week or create a truce to get to the World Cup and then end it...It has to end," said Neville. He added that the club is "better without" Cristiano and manager "Erik ten Hag knows that".

240.title: 20,000 yaba tablets being smuggled to Bangladesh seized in Assam
240.article_body: A suspected drug peddler was arrested and as many as 20,000 yaba tablets were recovered from him in Assam's Karimganj district on Sunday. The seizure was made from a car while the drugs was being smuggled to Bangladesh. The action was taken by the BSF, vigilant troops of Mizoram and Cachar Frontier, police said.

241.title: Deep depression over Bay of Bengal intensifies into cyclonic storm ‘Sitrang’
241.article_body: The deep depression developing in the Bay of Bengal intensified into cyclonic storm 'Sitrang' on Sunday evening. It will make landfall between Tinkona Island and Sandwip close to Bangladesh's Barisal in the early hours of Tuesday. The cyclone is likely to bring heavy to very heavy rain in coastal districts of South 24 Parganas and North 24 Parganas on Monday.

242.title: Hasbulla jokingly punches Ranveer Singh at UFC 280, actor shares video
242.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who attended UFC 280 in Abu Dhabi, took to Instagram Stories and shared a video with Hasbulla. In the video, Hasbulla can be seen punching Ranveer jokingly. Along with the video, Ranveer wrote, "Hasbulla taking no prisoners." Ranveer also shared pictures with Steven Seagal and Steve Harvey, who also attended the event.

243.title: Credit to Hardik, Virat for their performances: Pak skipper Babar
243.article_body: Despite losing to India by four wickets, Pakistan skipper Babar Azam said that his team bowled really well. "All credit to Kohli and Pandya. It wasn't easy with the new ball. We had partnerships after 10 overs," Babar said. "We had a lot of positives [from the match especially,] the way Iftikhar played and the way Shan played," he added.

244.title: France defender Varane's injury less serious than feared: Reports
244.article_body: Manchester United's French defender Raphael Varane's injury is reportedly "less serious than feared" and he can "still have hope" of playing in the World Cup. Varane left the pitch in tears with a leg injury during United's 1-1 draw against Chelsea on Saturday. Reports say Varane is expected to be out injured for between three and four weeks.

245.title: Very happy with my bowling: Arshdeep after taking 3 for 32
245.article_body: Indian pacer Arshdeep Singh said he is very happy with his bowling after the 23-year-old cricketer took three scalps against Pakistan in Melbourne on Sunday. "I didn't work too much on myself, just trying to keep things simple...We were talking..that we will take wickets in the starting and will restrict Pakistan...All credit goes to our batters," Arshdeep said.

246.title: Story for future generations: Ayushmann on watching final overs of IND vs PAK in flight
246.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana on Sunday recounted his experience of watching the final overs of today's match where India beat Pakistan, on a Mumbai-Chandigarh flight. Khurrana said, "This story is for my future generations." He said, "I've never witnessed a collective uproar of applause inside an aircraft...Thank you team India and Virat (Kohli) for bringing in Diwali a day early."

247.title: My best knock ever in T20Is, I'm lost for words: Virat Kohli on his 82*(53) against Pak
247.article_body: Virat Kohli, who smashed 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match, said it's his best knock ever in T20I cricket. "I have no words, no idea how that happened. I am really lost for words," he added. He stated that his previous best knock was 82*(51) against Australia in T20 World Cup 2016.

248.title: 90,293 spectators watched India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match at MCG
248.article_body: As many as 90,293 spectators watched India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, the ICC said. Reacting to the ICC's post on Twitter, a fan tweeted, "90,293 lucky people witnessed Greatest of All Time cricket match." India defeated Pakistan by four wickets by completing the chase on the last ball of the match.

249.title: Have lost my voice screaming: Sushmita Sen after India's win over Pak
249.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan by four wickets in the T20 World Cup 2022, actress Sushmita Sen took to Twitter and congratulated the team. "WHAT A GAME...Salute Virat Kohli, have lost my voice screaming!" Abhishek Bachchan also took to Twitter and wrote, "King Kohli!!! That's the tweet." Kohli scored 53-ball 82 in the match against Pakistan.

250.title: Kohli, Hardik break record of highest partnership for India against Pakistan in T20Is
250.article_body: Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya on Sunday broke the record for registering the highest partnership for India in a T20I against Pakistan. Kohli and Hardik registered a 113-run fifth-wicket stand to break the record. The previous record was held by MS Dhoni and Yuvraj Singh, who had recorded a 97-run fourth-wicket stand against Pakistan in a T20I in 2012.

251.title: Shoaib Akhtar shares pic to question umpires for giving no-ball in India's last over
251.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar shared a picture to question umpires for giving a waist-high no-ball in India’s last over against Pakistan in T20 World Cup, apparently suggesting it shouldn’t have been called a no-ball. “Umpire bhaiyo...food for thought aaj raat k liye (Umpires...food for thought for tonight),” Akhtar wrote. Kohli slammed a six off the no-ball bowled by Muhammad Nawaz.

252.title: India equal Aus' record for achieving highest target in last 3 overs of a T20 WC match
252.article_body: India on Sunday equalled Australia's record for achieving the highest target in the last three overs of a T20 World Cup match. India chased down 48 runs in the last three overs against Pakistan to equal the record. Australia had also chased 48 runs off last three overs against Pakistan in a T20 World Cup 2010 match.

253.title: So inspiring to see Virat Kohli cry and smile: Shah Rukh Khan on India's win vs Pakistan
253.article_body: Following India's four-wicket win over Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, actor Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "So good to see a great game of cricket. So wonderful to see India win." He added, "So brilliant to see Virat Kohli batting...and so inspiring to see him cry and smile...and the background score of Chak de India!! Happy Diwali starts right now!!!"

254.title: Irfan Pathan shares video of Sunil Gavaskar dancing during India's run chase vs Pakistan
254.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Instagram to share a video of Sunil Gavaskar dancing during India's run chase against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022. He wrote, "What scenes here at the MCG. Even the great Sunny ji couldn’t stop dancing...Virat you are the real king." "Look at Sunny bhai's enthusiasm," an Instagram user commented.

255.title: To divert public attention: Cong MP on action against Rajiv Gandhi Foundation
255.article_body: After the central government cancelled the FCRA licences of the Rajiv Gandhi Foundation (RGF) and Rajiv Gandhi Charitable Trust (RGCT), Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said the move is aimed at "defaming the Congress". "They (Centre) recycle old charges against the RGF and RGCT. This is to...divert public attention from issues of day-to-day concern faced by them," Ramesh added.

256.title: 'Rishi Sunak isn't even British', says racist caller on UK radio station; host responds
256.article_body: A racist caller joined a UK radio station and said, "Rishi Sunak isn't going to win the next general election...He's not even British." The show's host Sangita Myska immediately corrected the man, and said, "Rishi Sunak was born in the UK...I think you are fundamentally a racist." Notably, Indian-origin Sunak has formally declared he's running for the UK PM's post.

257.title: The MCG pitch for Ind-Pak game had something in it: Rohit Sharma
257.article_body: After winning the game by four wickets against Pakistan at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday, Indian skipper Rohit Sharma said that the pitch had something in it. "There was a nice carry. Some swing and seam. Good to see from the bowling perspective...We knew we had to bat out of our skin to chase this," Rohit said.

258.title: Sena's Priyanka Chaturvedi criticises minister who slapped woman
258.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi criticised Karnataka Minister V Somanna for allegedly slapping a woman during a public event. "BJP Minister. Karnataka. Likely explanation: Not a slap on the face but blessings on the cheek," she added. Chaturvedi also accused the government and the National Commission for Women of being silent on the issue.

259.title: Deadline to submit bids for Future Retail extended to November 3
259.article_body: As per the modified invitation of expression of interest (EoI) for Future Retail, which is undergoing the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process, the final date to submit bids has been extended to November 3. The final list of prospective buyers will be published on November 20, and the deadline for the submission of the resolution plan is December 15.

260.title: RPF officials save woman who fell from moving train while deboarding; video surfaces
260.article_body: A video showing a woman slipping while deboarding a train at Muzaffarpur station in Bihar has surfaced on social media. The video, shared by Railway Protection Force (RPF), shows RPF officials pulling her just as she was about to fall in gap between platform and train and be crushed under its wheels. She had reportedly boarded the train to defecate.

261.title: Kohli's best innings for India: Rohit on Virat's 82*(53) vs Pak
261.article_body: After Indian batter Virat Kohli scored 82*(53) against Pakistan on Sunday, skipper Rohit Sharma said that this was the best innings that Kohli has played for his country. "Taking the game deep was very critical...We were in no position to [get that target]. The way we won is more pleasing to us. Hats off to Virat" Rohit said.

262.title: Russian, British defence ministers discuss the situation in Ukraine
262.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu on Sunday discussed the situation in Ukraine with his British counterpart, Ben Wallace, over a telephone call, Russian media reported, citing the defence ministry. During the call, Shoigu reportedly conveyed Moscow's apprehension regarding Kyiv's plan to use a "dirty bomb" in Ukraine. Russia has provided no evidence regarding the claim about Kyiv's intention.

263.title: UK's destiny lies in Europe, Brexit sold as a 'mirage': EU official
263.article_body: EU's industry chief Thierry Breton on Sunday said Britain's destiny lies in Europe and that Brexit was sold to the country as "a sort of mirage". Breton said this while speaking about the current political turmoil in the UK. "We have a country which is completely destabilised, and a political party as well," Breton added, referring to the Conservative Party.

264.title: Virat Kohli, you are special: Shahid Kapoor after India's win over Pak
264.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor took to Instagram and shared a picture of Virat Kohli after the latter scored a match-winning 53-ball 82 runs against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022. "Virat, you are special. Thank you for today. If you believe and if you persevere, you become the vessel through which the world witnesses magic," Shahid captioned the post.

265.title: Cometh the hour, cometh the stage, cometh the man: Ravi Shastri on Virat Kohli
265.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last delivery in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, Ravi Shastri shared a picture of Rohit Sharma lifting Virat Kohli. Praising Kohli for his 82*(53), Shastri wrote, "Cometh the hour, cometh the stage, cometh the man @virat.kohli." Kohli came to bat in the second over after KL Rahul's dismissal.

266.title: Ayodhya sets Guinness World Record as nearly 16 lakh diyas lit, pics released
266.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Sunday shared pictures as 15.76 lakh lamps were lit in Ayodhya on the eve of Diwali, in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "World record re-established...Ayodhya entered the Guinness Book of World Records," said a UP Tourism Twitter page. PM Modi launched the Deepotsav celebrations on the banks of the river Sarayu on Sunday.

267.title: Sehwag shares PM Modi's 'Rona band kijiye' meme for Pakistan after their loss to India
267.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to social media to share PM Narendra Modi's 'Aap log rona band kijiye (Please stop crying)' meme for Pakistan after their defeat to India in T20 World Cup 2022. "Request to neighbours," he captioned. "I hope they don't break TVs today," a Team India fan commented on his post on Instagram.

268.title: If an eagle doesn't fly for 2 days, pigeons can't claim the sky: RP Singh on Virat Kohli
268.article_body: Praising Virat Kohli for smashing 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan on last ball in T20 World Cup 2022, former India pacer RP Singh tweeted, "If an eagle doesn't fly for 2 days, pigeons can't claim the sky." Meanwhile, Merv Hughes tweeted, "How good Virat!!!! Outstanding!!" "Virat Kohli well and truly back to his best," wrote Ian Bishop.

269.title: There was no slap: Woman allegedly 'hit' by Karnataka minister
269.article_body: The woman who was allegedly slapped by Karnataka minister and BJP MLA V Somanna refuted the allegations saying "there was no slap". "I went there to ask for help and requested him to give land. At the same time, I fell on his feet and somebody said [Somanna] slapped me," she said. "It's just an allegation against [Somanna]," she added.

270.title: 'Sabka sath, sabka vikas' inspired by Lord Ram's values: PM Modi
270.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the 'Deepotsav' celebrations in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya on Sunday said the concept of 'sabka saath, sabka vikas' was drawn from the values inculcated by Lord Ram. PM Modi addressed a gathering at the Ram Katha park ahead of Diwali. He also offered prayers to Ram Lalla at the temporary Ram temple.

271.title: Salman Rushdie has lost sight in one eye, one hand incapacitated: Agent
271.article_body: Salman Rushdie has lost vision in one eye and one of his hands is incapacitated, his agent said in an update two months after the India-born author was attacked and stabbed multiple times in New York. "He had three serious wounds in his neck. One hand is incapacitated because the nerves in his arm were cut," Rushdie's agent added.

272.title: 7 including 2 minors arrested over software engineer's gang-rape in J'khand
272.article_body: Seven people, including two minors, have been arrested in connection with the gang-rape of a 26-year-old software engineer in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum, according to police. The arrests were made after interrogating some local residents who frequented the area in Chaibasa, where the incident took place, police added. The woman's wallet and mobile phones were recovered from the accused.

273.title: Scheduled outages introduced in Kyiv after strikes on energy infra
273.article_body: Scheduled "stabilisation" power cuts were introduced in the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv on Sunday "to avoid accidents" following repeated Russian attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure, Kyiv's power operator DTEK said during the day. The outages should last "no more than four hours" but may be longer "due to the scale of damage to the power supply system", DTEK added.

274.title: Been a beautiful year: Radhika Madan on completing 'Soorarai...' remake
274.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan took to Instagram Stories and shared a picture from the sets of her untitled film with actor Akshay Kumar. "It's a wrap for project number five of this year! It's been a beautiful beautiful year guys. Can't wait to see you at the movies," Radhika wrote. The film is a remake of the Tamil film 'Soorarai Pottru'.

275.title: Pakistan will not agree for neutral venue for 2023 Asia Cup: Engineer
275.article_body: After BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said that India won't travel to Pakistan for the 2023 Asia Cup, ex-cricketer Farokh Engineer said that Pakistan won't agree to hold the tournament at a neutral venue. "They (Pakistan) need the resources and foreign teams to play in Pakistan. They have been deprived of cricket for a long time," Engineer said.

276.title: One of the greatest victories under pressure: Rahul on Ind-Pak match
276.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi congratulated the Indian team for its victory over Pakistan by four wickets in Melbourne on Sunday. "What a thriller of a match against Pakistan...One of the greatest victories under pressure. Well done team India...Best of luck for the matches ahead [in the T20 World Cup]," Rahul tweeted. Notably, batter Virat Kohli scored 82*(53).

277.title: Russia's 2 largest banks open vostro account for overseas Rupee trade
277.article_body: Russia's two largest banks, Sberbank and VTB Bank, have opened special vostro accounts following permission from the Reserve Bank of India to facilitate overseas trade in Rupee. The banks have reportedly opened these accounts in their branches in Delhi. The vostro account enables settlement of payments in rupee for trade between India and Russia, enabling cross-border trade in Rupee.

278.title: I'm sorry if anyone felt hurt: K'taka minister as video shows him slapping woman
278.article_body: After a video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman surfaced online, the minister said, "Though I did not misbehave at all but if anyone felt hurt then I apologise and express my regret." "I was trying to make her stand aside, indicating her with my hand. There was no other intention...I have high regards for women," Somanna added.

279.title: Cricket can be cruel and unfair: Ramiz Raja after India beat Pakistan in T20 World Cup
279.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan on the last ball in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja tweeted, "A classic!" He added, "You win some, you lose some and as we all know this game can be cruel and unfair. #TeamPakistan couldn't have given more with bat and ball. Very proud of the effort!"

280.title: Hardik breaks down remembering late father after India's last-ball win vs Pak
280.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya broke down remembering his late father after India defeated Pakistan on the last ball in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday. "He left his city and came to another city for cricket career of his sons. It's a huge thing," Hardik said. Hardik's father passed away in January 2021 due to heart attack.

281.title: PM Narendra Modi launches Deepotsav celebrations in UP's Ayodhya
281.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday launched the Deepotsav celebrations in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya, on the eve of the festival of Diwali. "Lord Ram doesn't leave anyone behind, doesn't turn away from anyone," PM Modi said. Over 15 lakh earthen lamps will be lit as part of Deepotsav celebrations by over 22,000 volunteers, said Ayodhya Divisional Commissioner Navdeep Rinwa.

282.title: It hurt: Vijay Varma on losing 'Kai Po Che' to Sushant Singh Rajput
282.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma revealed he had auditioned for a role in the 2013 film 'Kai Po Che', which was eventually played by late actor Sushant Singh Rajput. "It hurt at that time but I've seen...actors who come up to me and say 'I wanted to do that role, you were doing'," he added. Vijay also auditioned for 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag'.

283.title: Raj Police share 'Diwali Dhamaka' poster to warn those spreading fake news
283.article_body: Rajasthan Police on Sunday shared a 'Diwali Dhamaka' to warn against sharing messages that may disturb communal harmony. "Free! Free! Free! Rajasthan Police's special offer on Diwali. One mistake can make you take a trip to the jail, and that too for free," it added. Police also urged people to light firecrackers in open spaces and not inside their homes.

284.title: Apple to run app-related ads on App Store from Oct 25
284.article_body: Apple announced that it will run app-related advertisements on App Store in the Today tab from October 25 in all countries except China. On its website, Apple wrote, "With a Today tab ad, your app can appear prominently on the front page of the App Store." The Today tab had no paid placement options previously.

285.title: Apple starts paying out $100 million fund to App Store developers: Report
285.article_body: Apple has reportedly started paying out $100 million cash reserve created as part of a class-action settlement to its App Store developers. The company agreed to create the Apple Smart Developer Assistance Fund under a lawsuit brought by the US developers concerned with App Store policies. Eligible developers stood to get paid from $250 to $30,000 under the settlement.

286.title: Man cheated of ₹3.5 crore over currency notes in Navi Mumbai
286.article_body: The CBD Belapur police in Navi Mumbai has filed a case against over half a dozen people for cheating a Gujarat businessman of ₹3.5 crore. The fraudsters promised the businessman to help him convert old currency notes into new ones that he could give as Diwali bonuses to employees. They later staged an 'arrest' to run away with the money.

287.title: Tree House Education gets clean chit in misstatements of financial case
287.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has given a clean chit to Tree House Education  & Accessories Ltd, its promoters and other officials in an alleged financial misstatements case after a financial audit. In a letter, SEBI said that since a forensic audit showed no instances of any financial misgivings, no action will be taken.

288.title: 29 wagons of goods train derail in UP, 20 other trains affected
288.article_body: As many as 29 wagons of a goods train derailed at Ramwa station near Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur on Sunday morning, disrupting the movement of 20 other trains on the route. Railway engineers said that work to clear the track is underway and traffic on the route is expected to return to normalcy by evening.

289.title: ICC shares pics of moments after India's last-ball win vs Pak, says 'Etched in history'
289.article_body: The ICC took to official Twitter account of T20 World Cup 2022 to share pictures of moments after Ravichandran Ashwin scored a single on the last ball to help India beat Pakistan in their Super 12 match. "Etched in history," the ICC captioned the post. India scored 16 runs off the last over to win the match by four wickets.

290.title: Soap and oil actors leave their shoots to film for ads: Subhash Ghai
290.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai, speaking about the current generation of actors, has said that the "soap and oil" actors leave their shoots to film for advertisements. "The actors of the 90s still understand the importance of the story...today's generation wants the money to come first, they're just bothered about their personal branding and fees," he added.

291.title: Google removes apps from Play Store for performing ad fraud: Report
291.article_body: Google has removed 16 apps from Play Store which were performing ad fraud as they were impersonating a real user by clicking on ads and redirecting to web pages in the background, a security firm alleged. These apps were also causing faster battery drain and high data usage on Android devices. They had 20 million downloads before they were removed.

292.title: Kerala Governor seeks resignations of VCs of 9 universities
292.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Sunday sought the resignations of vice-chancellors of nine universities in the state. He directed the VCs that the resignations should reach him by 11.30 am on Monday. The Governor upheld a recent Supreme Court order quashing the appointment of the VCs of APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University for being contrary to UGC regulations.

293.title: Rohit Sharma lifts Virat Kohli in joy after India beat Pakistan, pics go viral
293.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma lifted Virat Kohli in joy after India defeated Pakistan on last ball in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. Pictures and videos showing the same went viral on social media. In one of the videos, Rohit can be seen running towards Kohli and lifting him up, while Hardik Pandya can be seen clapping.

294.title: Virat Kohli alone burst firecrackers for the entire country: Sunil Chhetri
294.article_body: Indian men's football team captain Sunil Chhetri took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli after the latter slammed 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "Virat Kohli alone burst firecrackers for the entire country...Happy Diwali, India," Chhetri wrote. India completed their 160-run chase against Pakistan on the last ball.

295.title: Kohli shares pics from India vs Pak T20 World Cup match, calls it a 'Special win'
295.article_body: Virat Kohli took to Instagram to share pictures from India versus Pakistan T20 World Cup match held in Melbourne on Sunday. "Special win. Thank you to all our fans for turning up in numbers," Kohli captioned the pictures. Kohli, who smashed 82*(53) against Pakistan, said, "I rank this innings as my best."

296.title: Which states & UTs have imposed curbs on firecrackers during Diwali this year?
296.article_body: Delhi and Haryana have banned the sale, purchase and use of fireworks on Diwali, with Haryana making an exception for green firecrackers. The Punjab government has allowed the bursting of crackers during the 8 pm-10 pm window, while in Tamil Nadu crackers can be burst during two one-hour windows. Bihar also banned crackers in Patna and two other cities.

297.title: Netflix to open gaming studio, seeks to explore cloud gaming
297.article_body: Netflix has decided to open its fifth gaming studio in Southern California as it looks to seriously explore a cloud gaming offering, company's Vice President, gaming, Mike Verdu said. Verdu added that Netflix is looking at the cloud gaming service as a "value add" and not as a "console replacement". At its studios, Netflix has 14 games in full development.

298.title: Undoubtedly the best innings of your life: Sachin to Kohli on his 82*(53) vs Pakistan
298.article_body: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli for his match-winning 82*(53) against Pakistan in India's first T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "It was undoubtedly the best innings of your life. It was a treat to watch you play, the six off back foot in 19th over against Rauf over long-on was spectacular!" Sachin wrote.

299.title: Fighter jet crashes into residential building in Russia's Irkutsk
299.article_body: A Russian fighter jet crashed into a residential building in Russia's Irkutsk city on Sunday, killing both pilots, Irkutsk region's governor said. The aircraft has been identified as a Sukhoi Su-30, which officials say was on a test flight. No one on the ground was hurt, as per authorities. Another Sukhoi jet crashed in Russia's Yeysk city earlier this week.

300.title: 35-yr-old man pushed from running train by Govt Reserve Police in UP; dies
300.article_body: A 35-year-old man, Arun Bhuiyan, died after he was allegedly pushed from a moving train by Government Reserve Police (GRP) officials near Unchdih railway station in Uttar Pradesh. According to a complaint filed by Bhuiyan's friend, an argument broke out between GRP officials and Bhuiyan. The argument then led to two GRP officials throwing Bhuiyan out of the train.

301.title: Mumbai-based NGO finds banned toxic chemicals in city's firecrackers
301.article_body: A Mumbai-based NGO conducted independent tests on firecrackers in the city and claimed some of them contain banned chemicals such as arsenic, sulphur, barium and chlorine. The NGO has written to the police and Maharashtra government on the same. They also conducted a noise test on the crackers and found that they all fell within the permissible 120-decibel limit.

302.title: You freaking beauty, you've brought joy on the eve of Diwali: Anushka on Virat
302.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma, the wife of cricketer Virat Kohli, took to Instagram to celebrate India's win over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup as Kohli smashed 82*(53). "You freaking beauty!! You've brought sooooo much joy in people's lives tonight and that too on the eve of Diwali," she said. "I've just watched the best match of my life," she added.

303.title: 3 dead, 8 injured in attack on hotel in Somalia's Kismayo
303.article_body: A blast hit a hotel in Somalia's port city of Kismayo when an explosives-laden car rammed into the hotel's gate on Sunday, following which gunfire erupted at the scene, according to police officials. At least three people were killed in the attack and eight others were injured, as per authorities. Militant group al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.

304.title: Shivling scene in 'Baahubali' created no controversy as it was respectful: Amish
304.article_body: Author Amish Tripathi opened up about the 'Shivling' scene from SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning' and said that the scene created no controversy. "It's one of the most iconic scenes in Indian cinema. It's a very respectful scene, viewers can see the intention," Amish added. In the scene, Prabhas breaks the base of 'Shivling' and carries it to the waterfall.

305.title: Banks financing Musk's Twitter deal to not sell debt to investors: Report
305.article_body: Banks providing $13 billion in financing for billionaire Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter have abandoned plans to sell the debt to investors because of uncertainty around Twitter's fortunes and losses, Reuters reported. Banks are reportedly planning to keep the debt on their balance sheets until there's more investor interest. Debt package for the Twitter deal is comprised of junk-rated loans.

306.title: Nasdaq pauses IPOs of small Chinese firms amid stock rallies probe
306.article_body: The IPOs of at least four small Chinese companies have been put on hold by Nasdaq as it investigates the short-lived stock rallies after the debut of these firms. Nasdaq has informed lawyers and bankers that some IPOs will not proceed "until they determined what has been the aberrational trading activity in certain Chinese issuers earlier this year".

307.title: Haryana govt declares 50% VAT rebate for industrial units using natural gas
307.article_body: The Haryana government announced that it has decided to offer a 50% rebate in value-added tax to industrial units that will replace diesel generators with natural gas. The scheme will be applicable to entire industry including micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs). The finance committee also approved a yearly subsidy of ₹164.66 crore to EV manufacturing companies under various heads.

308.title: My heart couldn't take that anymore: Rishad Premji as India beats Pak in T20 WC
308.article_body: Taking to Twitter to congratulate Virat Kohli and the Indian Cricket Team for their win against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup, Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji said, "My heart couldn't take that anymore." India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last ball in Melbourne. Rishad Premji further added, "Truly amazing - team India and Virat Kohli!!"

309.title: Gandhi family, its NGOs not above law: BJP on FCRA licence cancellation
309.article_body: BJP welcomed the cancellation of the FCRA licences of Rajiv Gandhi Foundation and Rajiv Gandhi Charitable Trust (RCGT) associated with the Gandhi family for allegedly violating the foreign funding law. The party said that the Gandhi family and organisations linked to it cannot be above the law. BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra claimed the action "exposed" Gandhi family's corruption.

310.title: Dr Reddy's, Cipla & Aurobindo Pharma's US-based units recall products
310.article_body: US-based unit of Dr Reddy's Laboratories is recalling 2,838 ampules of vitamin K deficiency treatment drug due to "failed stability specifications", according to the US Food and Drug Administration. Cipla is recalling 9,041 cartons of a COPD medicine due to "lack of assurance of sterility". Aurobindo Pharma's US unit is recalling 80,080 vials of injection used to control heavy bleeding.

311.title: FPIs sell Indian equities worth nearly ₹6,000 crore in October
311.article_body: The data with the depositories showed that foreign investors have sold Indian equities worth ₹5,992 crore in October (till 21) as the dollar strengthened against the rupee. The total outflow by Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) has reached ₹1.75 lakh crore so far in 2022. However, according to data, FPIs had slowed down their selling substantially during the last few days.

312.title: ICC shares graphic after Kohli helps India beat Pakistan, tweets 'The King is back'
312.article_body: After Virat Kohli's 82*(53) helped India defeat Pakistan on last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match, the official Twitter handle of ICC shared a graphic showing Kohli sitting on a throne. "The King is back...Take a bow, Virat Kohli," the ICC wrote. Kohli's innings included six fours and four sixes.

313.title: Virat Kohli punches ground, tears up after India defeat Pakistan on last ball, video viral
313.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Virat Kohli tearing up after Team India defeated Pakistan on the last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match in Melbourne on Sunday. The video also shows Kohli punching the ground after his 82*(53) helped India chase down the 160-run target. Kohli smashed six fours and four sixes in the match.

314.title: 'Adipurush' director releases new poster of Prabhas on actor's b'day
314.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut has released a new poster of actor Prabhas as Lord Ram on the occasion of the actor's 43rd birthday. Taking to Instagram, Raut shared the poster and wrote, "Maryada Purushottam Prabhu Shree Ram." Prabhas also shared the poster on his Instagram account. Recently, the film's teaser was trolled on Twitter over its VFX.

315.title: Deepawali begins: Amit Shah after India defeats Pakistan in T20 World Cup
315.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah took to Twitter on Sunday to congratulate the Indian cricket team for defeating Pakistan in the T20 World Cup match in Melbourne. "A perfect way to start the T20 World Cup...Deepawali begins," Shah tweeted. "What a cracking innings by Virat Kohli. Congratulations to the entire team," he added.

316.title: PM Modi offers prayers to Ram Lalla at Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya
316.article_body: PM Narendra Modi offered prayers to Ram Lalla at Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya ahead of Diwali on Sunday. Modi arrived in Ayodhya to attend Deepotsav celebrations, during which around 18 lakh earthen lamps will be lit to celebrate Diwali. PM Modi was welcomed by Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel and CM Yogi Adityanath.

317.title: Mobile phone suddenly explodes during repair in UP; video goes viral
317.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media which showed a mobile phone suddenly exploding while it was being repaired at a mobile shop in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur. Reportedly, the mobile was brought in for repair due to a problem with its charging. The shopkeeper and two others had a narrow escape in the incident.

318.title: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to visit India in Nov: Reports
318.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will reportedly visit India on November 14 while on his way to the G20 summit in Bali, Indonesia. The Crown Prince is visiting India on the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and it will be a day-long visit, reports citing sources said. Last week, Saudi Energy Minister Abdulaziz bin Salman visited India.

319.title: China will open its door wider to the world: Xi Jinping
319.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Sunday said his country will open its door wider to the rest of the world. "China cannot develop in isolation from the world. The world's development also needs China," Xi stated. This came as Xi secured a third term as the Chinese Communist Party's head, making him the most influential party leader since Mao Zedong.

320.title: India defeat Pakistan on last ball in T20 World Cup as Virat Kohli smashes 82*(53)
320.article_body: India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Melbourne on Sunday. India chased down the 160-run target as Virat Kohli smashed an unbeaten 82 off 53 deliveries. India have now won nine out of 12 T20I matches against Pakistan.

321.title: No women in China's Politburo for the first time in 25 years
321.article_body: The Chinese Communist Party's decision-making body, Politburo, will have no women members for the first time in 25 years. Sun Chunlan, the only woman sitting on the previous Politburo, has retired. China will be ruled by an all-male Politburo for the next five years as President Xi Jinping secures a historic third term in power.

322.title: Don't insult common man by calling facilities 'revdi': Kejriwal to PM
322.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked PM Narendra Modi to not insult the common man by calling facilities of free education and treatment as "revdi". Tweeting a report of PM Modi slamming the political culture of "revdi" or freebies, Kejriwal said, "People are quite worried due to inflation. Why should they not get free education, treatment, medicines and electricity?"

323.title: MP CM Shivraj Chouhan celebrates Diwali with COVID orphans at his residence
323.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan celebrated Diwali eve at his residence with COVID orphans who lost their parents during the pandemic. He extended Diwali greetings to the children and was also seen dancing with them. According to the reports, 315 children were present in the programme. He planted saplings with the children before the beginning of the celebrations.

324.title: Mob thrashes suspected cattle smuggler, sets his vehicle on fire
324.article_body: A mob thrashed a man over the suspicion of smuggling cattle in West Bengal's Howrah. The mob set his vehicle, allegedly used for the act, on fire. "Locals witnessed a few cattle smugglers taking an ox in their wagon. One accused was caught and handed over to the police, while the rest are absconding," a local resident said.

325.title: Ludhiana civic body carries out trials for anti-smog guns ahead of Diwali
325.article_body: In view of rising pollution levels, the municipal corporation has begun conducting trials for anti-smog guns across different parts of Ludhiana. Attached with tractors, generator and a water tanker, the guns were taken through the city’s main roads and markets as part of the trials. Authorities said the anti-smog guns will be stationed at certain points after Diwali.

326.title: Virat Kohli overtakes Rohit Sharma to become highest run-scorer in T20I cricket
326.article_body: Former India captain Virat Kohli on Sunday overtook India captain Rohit Sharma to become the highest run-getter in T20I cricket. After scoring his first 30 runs in India's T20 World Cup 2022 opener against Pakistan, Kohli overtook Rohit's tally of 3,741 runs. Kohli is playing his 102nd innings in T20I cricket.

327.title: Will have low-key Diwali celebrations among family members: Randhir
327.article_body: Actor Randhir Kapoor shared that the Kapoor family will have "low-key" Diwali celebrations. "We are meeting each other...When we meet, that itself becomes a party as we're a very big family," he shared. Randhir added that the family will have a get-together at Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan's house on Sunday evening.

328.title: BJP and RSS were trying to rewrite India's history: Cong MLA Abdur Rashid
328.article_body: Assam Congress MLA Abdur Rashid Mandal criticised the BJP and the RSS and alleged that both organisations were trying to rewrite the history of India. "[They] are now trying to create a fake history of the country. Everyone knows the history of India. When the BJP-RSS are rewriting India's history, it is only a history [of hate]," said Mandal.

329.title: Won’t let BJP turn K’taka into lab of hatred, misgovernance: Rahul
329.article_body: Congress won't allow Karnataka to be turned into a laboratory for BJP’s experiments with hatred and misgovernance, party leader Rahul Gandhi said. "Through untiring efforts of our state leaders, drawing on rich cultures of Karnataka and support of crores of Kannadigas, that day will soon come when we will unleash Karnataka’s true potential through the path of love...harmony," he added.

330.title: India record their lowest 10-over score against Pakistan in T20I cricket history
330.article_body: India today recorded their lowest 10-over score against Pakistan in a T20I. India were restricted to 45/4 in first 10 overs by Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. India lost wickets of Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, Suryakumar Yadav and Axar Patel within the first seven overs. India's previous lowest 10-over score in a T20I against Pakistan was 53/3.

331.title: K'taka withdraws order to collect ₹100 donation from govt school students
331.article_body: The Karnataka government has withdrawn an order to collect ₹100 as monthly donations from students to develop government primary and high schools. The order, which was issued earlier this month, has been criticised by parents and opposition parties. "After looting 40% commission from government coffers, they now want to loot from the parents too," Congress leader Siddaramaiah had said.

332.title: Hardik, Rohit get angry as spider cam denies India a potential wicket vs Pak, video viral
332.article_body: A video went viral showing India captain Rohit Sharma and all-rounder Hardik Pandya getting angry after spider cam denied India a potential wicket of Pakistan's Shan Masood in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. Masood had lofted a Ravichandran Ashwin delivery which went on to hit spider cam wire before landing in no-man's land. Masood scored 52*(42) in the innings.

333.title: Happiest Minds fires 'few' employees for moonlighting, calls it 'unacceptable'
333.article_body: Bengaluru-based IT services firm Happiest Minds Technologies fired a "few" employees who were found to be moonlighting, company executive Joseph Anantharaju told PTI. "[Moonlighting] is something we will not accept...because when you sign a contract or employment offer, you are agreeing to work only for that company," he said. Moonlighting practice is "not too pervasive" at the company, he added.

334.title: Telegram to auction usernames for 700 million users via blockchain
334.article_body: Telegram has announced that it'll auction off usernames for 700 million users on its messaging app via its blockchain-based platform. Telegram said it would use The Open Network blockchain to host the auction. "This would create a new platform where username holders could transfer them to interested parties in protected deals," said Telegram Founder Pavel Durov.

335.title: Some of us from different parties will join Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maha: Pawar
335.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said he will participate in Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra wherever possible when it enters Maharashtra. "Bharat Jodo Yatra is a Congress party programme but through this, an attempt is being made to bring harmony in society. So, some of us from different parties will join the march wherever possible when it's in Maharashtra," Pawar said.

336.title: Sonu Sood to make writing debut with action-thriller film 'Fateh'
336.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood will be making his writing debut with his upcoming action-thriller film 'Fateh'. "Personally, I have worked a lot on script and screenplay...But I'll take the credit for this for the first time," Sood said. He shared that the film revolves around the issue of digital scams for which the team has been consulting with ethical hackers.

337.title: The team deserves applause for their efforts: MP Medical Education Minister
337.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Medical Education Minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang, while talking about Hindi MBBS books said "the entire...team deserves applause for their relentless efforts for over six months to make it happen". "Those raising questions on introduction of Hindi in MBBS courses should know that the system which is going to be...implemented for the first time...is a revolutionary step," he added.

338.title: 21 kg heroin seized from truck on Jammu-Srinagar highway, driver detained
338.article_body: A truck driver was detained on Sunday after 18 packets of heroin, weighing around 21.5 kg, were seized from his vehicle on Jammu-Srinagar national highway in J&K’s Udhampur. The seized contraband is worth crores of rupees in the international market, an official said. "During checking...at Zero Point on the highway at Chenani, truck coming from Kashmir…was intercepted," the official stated.

339.title: RSS leader pays visit to Delhi's Nizamuddin Dargah ahead of Diwali
339.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar visited Hazrat Nizamuddin Dargah in New Delhi and lit earthen lamps inside the premises of the shrine. "The festival of Diwali is celebrated in the world, including India...This festival erases all the religious differences...Everyone should follow their own religion and caste. Do not criticise and insult others' religions," said Kumar.

340.title: Pune man tries stealing power for Diwali stall, dies
340.article_body: While attempting to steal electricity for a Diwali stall set up by a woman in Aundh, a Pune man died of electrocution. The deceased, identified as Pravin Ashok Mane, tried to steal electricity from a Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) feeder pillar. The woman and the deceased were booked under IPC and the Electricity Act.

341.title: Delhi records 'poor' air quality for 8th straight day ahead of Diwali
341.article_body: The air quality in Delhi was recorded in the 'poor' category for the eighth consecutive day on Sunday as smog engulfed Delhi and neighbouring areas. The overall AQI in Delhi was recorded at 243 at 10 am on Sunday. It was around 265 on Saturday evening. The air quality is likely to deteriorate in the coming days.

342.title: Gurugram records 2nd highest number of dengue cases in last 7 yrs
342.article_body: After four new dengue cases were reported in Gurugram on Saturday, the district took its total tally of cases to 337 for this year, while 327 cases were reported last year. This is the second-highest number of dengue cases recorded in the district in the last seven years. The worst-hit areas have been Wazirabad, Farrukhnagar, Pataudi and Ghangola, among others.

343.title: 2 more people test positive for Ebola in Uganda's capital Kampala
343.article_body: Uganda's Health Ministry on Sunday said two more people, who were admitted in an isolation unit of the country's main hospital in the capital city of Kampala, had tested positive for Ebola. On Saturday, the ministry reported three confirmed cases from the same hospital. The five confirmed cases are the first known transmission of the virus in Kampala.

344.title: Robbie Coltrane's death certificate reveals multiple causes including sepsis & diabetes
344.article_body: Actor Robbie Coltrane, who passed away recently, died from a series of conditions including multiple organ failure, sepsis, lower respiratory tract infection and heart block. According to his death certificate, the actor also suffered from diabetes and obesity. Coltrane, who was famous for his role as Rubeus Hagrid in 'Harry Potter' films, had been unwell for some time.

345.title: Interpol launches world's first global police Metaverse
345.article_body: International crime control organisation Interpol has launched the world's first global police Metaverse for law enforcement officials to increase cooperation. Users of this Metaverse can interact with each other and even take training courses on forensic investigation and other policing capabilities. Interpol will also create an expert group to represent officials' views on security in Metaverse.

346.title: Shameless man should be sacked: Jairam after K’taka minister slaps woman
346.article_body: After a video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman during a public event was widely shared online, Congress’ Jairam Ramesh tweeted, "This shameless man should be sacked immediately!" Furthermore, he said, "What a difference from the way Rahul Gandhi began the Karnataka leg of Bharat Jodo Yatra from the very same Gundlupet on 30th September!"

347.title: Kheda caning victims file case against police officers in Gujarat HC
347.article_body: The Gujarat High Court issued a notice to 15 police personnel allegedly involved in the public flogging of Muslim men in Kheda district earlier this month. The five victims who filed the case were accused of pelting stones during a garba event. They also claimed that the police violated Supreme Court's directions on how to deal with people in custody.

348.title: Palestinian group says its member killed by Israel in 'targeted explosion'
348.article_body: A senior member of the Palestinian militant group "Den of Lions" was killed overnight on Sunday in a "targeted explosion" carried out by Israel, according to the group. Tamer Kilani was killed in West Bank's Nablus city when a bomb placed on a motorcycle parked nearby was detonated, the group informed. The Israeli military declined to comment on the explosion.

349.title: Haven't seen a film like this: Vivek Agnihotri on 'Kantara'
349.article_body: Director Vivek Agnihotri said he hasn't seen a film like 'Kantara', which he called Rishab Shetty's "masterpiece" and a film that is "full of art and folklore". "One of the finest films I have seen in a long time. Congratulations Rishab for making wonderful cinema...great cinematography," he said. Earlier, Kangana Ranaut, Ram Gopal Varma and others also praised the film.

350.title: I hate it, I'm disgusted with such people: Jaya Bachchan on media persons
350.article_body: Speaking about media persons, Jaya Bachchan said they sell products by invading people's personal space. "I hate it, I'm disgusted with such people. I always tell them, I say, 'Aapko sharam nahi aati hai?' (Don't you feel ashamed?)," she added. "I despise the people who interfere in your personal life...fill their stomachs by selling those products," Jaya stated.

351.title: Pune will get 7 new police stations: Chandrakant Patil
351.article_body: District Guardian Minister Chandrakant Patil said that Pune will get seven new police stations in the city after he conducted a meeting with police officials.
