Patil also stated that steps will be taken to address shortage of manpower in the city police. The police stations will come up at Wagholi, Kharadi, Phursungi, Baner, Nanded City, Kale Padal and Ambegaon.

352.title: MP bans firecrackers in Gwalior, Singrauli and Katni due to poor air quality
352.article_body:
Madhya Pradesh government has banned firecrackers in Gwalior, Singrauli and Katni districts due to poor Air Quality Index (AQI). The government issued a notice that states green crackers can be burst from 8 pm to 10 pm only in those cities where the air quality is medium or below category. 
A letter has been written to the local district collectors.

353.title: Suresh Raina's 'Arshdeep will dismiss Babar' prediction comes true, fans react
353.article_body: After India fast bowler Arshdeep Singh dismissed Pakistan captain Babar Azam for a golden duck in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday, fans reacted to Suresh Raina's two-day-old prediction coming true. One of the fans wrote, "Einstein of palmistry?" "Very Prophetic. Are you the new Jofra Archer?" wrote another fan.

354.title: Hardik Pandya smiles at Pakistan's Haider Ali after dismissing him, pic goes viral
354.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya smiled at Pakistan's Haider Ali after dismissing him in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. Haider Ali was dismissed on the last ball of the 14th over after being caught in the deep by Suryakumar Yadav. Hardik Pandya registered bowling figures of 4-0-30-3 in the match.

355.title: Amit Shah congratulates ISRO on successful launch of 36 satellites
355.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) for the successful launch of its heaviest rocket with 36 OneWeb satellites and called it a landmark day for India's space programme. "India stepped into a new era of self-reliance with the successful launch of its heaviest rocket, LVM3...Congratulations to our scientists and the entire team," said Shah.

356.title: Hyd police, narcotics wing arrest 3 persons, seize 40 gm cocaine
356.article_body: Panjagutta Police and Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing have arrested a Nigerian man and two others for allegedly peddling drugs, Hyderabad City Police said on Saturday. Police added that 40 gm of cocaine and eight phones worth a total of ₹5 lakh were also seized. So far, five people who're purchasing drugs from the accused have been identified, police further said.

357.title: Man hacked to death after wife beats her harassers with sandals in B'luru
357.article_body: After a woman hit her harassers with sandals after being told to do so in Bengaluru, her husband was hacked to death. Preliminary investigations revealed that the husband was killed as revenge. The deceased, a 33-year-old man, was hacked to death while he was standing on the terrace of his house, reports said.

358.title: Gurugram Police arrest 3 men for cheating in Delhi Police Examination
358.article_body: Gurugram Police arrested three people, including the manager of a multinational firm and a scholar, for allegedly cheating in the Delhi Police Examination 2022. The accused have been identified as Tarun Shukla, Jaiveer Kumar and Lalit Yadav. Notably, Shukla helped Kumar enter the test centre illegally in order to write the exam for Yadav, police said.

359.title: 8 of top 10 most valued firms add ₹2 lakh cr to m-cap; RIL top gainer
359.article_body: Market capitalisation (m-cap) of eight of top 10 most valued firms rose by ₹2.03 lakh crore  as Sensex rose 1,466.46 points, or 2.54%, over the last week. Top gainer Reliance Industries Limited's (RIL) m-cap rose ₹68,296.41 crore to ₹16.72 lakh crore. RIL was followed by SBI, which added ₹30,120.57 crore, and ICICI Bank, which added ₹25,946.89 crore to its m-cap.

360.title: Rishi Sunak declares he's running to become the UK's next PM
360.article_body: Indian-origin Rishi Sunak on Sunday formally declared that he's running to become the UK's next Prime Minister. "I want to fix our economy, unite our Party and deliver for our country," Sunak tweeted. This comes after Liz Truss resigned as the UK's PM 45 days after taking over the role.

361.title: ICICI Bank reappoints Sandeep Bakhshi as MD, CEO for 3 years
361.article_body: The board of directors of ICICI Bank has re-appointed Sandeep Bakhshi as the managing director (MD) and chief executive officer (CEO) of the bank for the next three years. The current tenure of Bakhshi was until October 3, 2023. Bakhshi's reappointment will be subject to the approval of the RBI and the shareholders of the bank.

362.title: 306 madrassas, including Darul Uloom, declared illegal in UP’s Saharanpur
362.article_body: The Saharanpur administration has declared 306 Islamic educational institutions as illegal, including Deoband's Darul Uloom, after a survey was conducted by the authorities. "An investigation was [conducted] on the basis of parameters set by the administration like the year of establishment of the madrassa, the society that runs it...and their source of income," an officer said.

363.title: Police seize ₹63 lakh hawala money in Hyderabad, 5 arrested
363.article_body: The Commissioner’s Task Force, in coordination with the Central Zone Police, busted a hawala racket on Sunday in Hyderabad's Troop Bazar and arrested five persons. The police seized cash worth ₹63,50,000 along with a two-wheeler, five mobile phones and a cashier machine. The police caught the accused while raiding an electrical godown at Ranuja Marketing.

364.title: Assam government hikes DA by 4% for employees
364.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, on Twitter, announced an additional dearness allowance (DA) of 4% for all government employees and all India service officers as a festival gift. He said the additional DA will be effective from July 1, and the additional amount will be paid with October's salary. It will increase the DA of the employees to 35%.

365.title: Representation matters: Priyanka on Diwali holiday in NYC schools
365.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra has reacted to the news of Diwali being announced as a public school holiday in New York City from 2023 onwards. "After all these years! My teenage self living in Queens is crying tears of joy. Representation matters," she wrote on Instagram. On the work front, Priyanka's next Bollywood project is 'Jee Le Zaraa'.

366.title: Adopt stray dogs, take them home if you want to feed them: Bombay HC
366.article_body: Bombay High Court's Nagpur Bench has said, "If any person is interested in feeding stray dogs, he shall first adopt the stray dog/bitch, bring it to home, register it with Municipal Authorities or put it in some dogs shelter." It also directed Nagpur civic body to impose up to ₹200 fine on people feeding stray dogs in public places.

367.title: Mandy Moore welcomes second child with husband Taylor, shares pics
367.article_body: Actress Mandy Moore and her husband Taylor Goldsmith welcomed their second child. On October 22, Moore shared some pictures on Instagram and introduced her newborn baby boy as Oscar Bennett Goldsmith. "Our hearts have doubled in size and the immediacy of the love is astounding. He is beyond words and we're so grateful for our family of four," she wrote.

368.title: New data transmission record set using a single light source
368.article_body: An international group of researchers from the Technical University of Denmark (DTU) and the Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg, Sweden have set a new data transmission record of 1.8 petabits per second. The record data transmission speed was achieved using only a single laser and an optical chip. Notably, 1 petabit corresponds to 1 million gigabits.

369.title: Student run over by bus at Bangalore University succumbs to injuries
369.article_body: The 23-year-old student, who was run over by a Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation bus at Bangalore University's Jnana Bharati campus, has succumbed to her injuries, 13 days after the accident. She had slipped while boarding the bus and was crushed under its rear wheel on October 10. Following the accident, students blocked the campus' gates and prevented vehicles from entering.

370.title: Plane carrying Gold's Gym owner & family crashes near Costa Rica; all 6 feared dead
370.article_body: A plane carrying businessman Rainer Schaller, who owns fitness and gym outlets like Gold's Gym and McFit, crashed into the Caribbean just off the Costa Rican coast. Piloted by a Swiss national, Schaller was travelling with his partner, Christiane Schikorsky, their two children and a fitness trainer. According to authorities, all six people are feared dead.

371.title: Ferrari hits railing on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link; no one hurt
371.article_body: A speeding Ferrari rammed into the railing on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link in Mumbai, police said. The car reportedly belongs to an industrialist. The police added that no one was injured in the incident. "The car was speeding and we suspect it was about to race on the Sea Link but...it veered out of control," a police official said.

372.title: B'luru cab drivers create groups on Telegram to connect with customers
372.article_body: Cab drivers in Bengaluru have created multiple groups on Telegram to stay connected with customers amid ongoing discussions between the Karnataka government and app-based cab aggregators like Ola and Uber. Drivers reportedly add customers they meet on a daily basis to the groups. Customers can ask for a cab in the group and the nearest driver interacts with them directly.

373.title: 2 killed as fire breaks out in Andhra Pradesh cracker shops, video surfaces
373.article_body: Two people were killed after a fire broke out at a cluster of cracker shops in Andhra Pradesh. Police said that the incident took place when the crackers were being unloaded from a van. A video of the burning shops surfaced online. An official statement said that the actual reason behind the fire is being ascertained.

374.title: Rohit Sharma gets emotional during National Anthem ahead of Pakistan match, video viral
374.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma got emotional during the National Anthem ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan in Melbourne. A video of the same has gone viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen trying to fight back tears. The ICC also shared the video on Instagram, writing, "The emotions are real!"

375.title: Arshdeep dismisses Babar Azam for golden duck on his first-ever T20 World Cup delivery
375.article_body: Team India fast bowler Arshdeep Singh dismissed Pakistan captain Babar Azam on his first-ever T20 World Cup delivery. The 23-year-old pacer, who is India's youngest member at T20 World Cup 2022, dismissed Babar LBW with an inswinging delivery. Babar opted for a review but the third umpire confirmed his dismissal.

376.title: Cong's Bharat Jodo Yatra enters T'gana after completing its K'taka leg
376.article_body: Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra entered Telangana on Sunday after completing its Karnataka leg. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was accorded a grand welcome at the Telangana-Karnataka border by Telangana Congress leaders. After entering Gudeballur, the yatra halted for a break on the occasion of Diwali. It will resume from there on the morning of October 27.

377.title: Man sitting inside car dies as gas cylinder fitted in vehicle explodes in TN
377.article_body: A person who was sitting inside a car in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore died after a gas cylinder that was fitted inside the vehicle exploded. The identity of the person is yet to be ascertained. Police said that the process of collecting evidence is on. Security has been tightened in the area following the incident.

378.title: I've switched off TV, doused myself with anti-jinx spray: Mahindra on India-Pak match
378.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra said that he has doused himself with "anti-jinx spray" ahead of India-Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "As always, I am ready for the...match...[I] have my anti-stress ball and worry beads at my side. And my TV set firmly switched off," he tweeted. Mahindra joked that he'll now only wait for news of the result.

379.title: Burn under control now: CEO on report of Unacademy's losses jumping 85% in FY22
379.article_body: Reacting to a report on Unacademy's losses jumping 85% from ₹1,537 crore in FY21 to ₹2,848 crore in FY22 due to high ESOP costs, CEO Gaurav Munjal tweeted, "We spent a lot in FY22 to gain market share. Burn is under control now." Earlier, a report said Unacademy has cut its monthly expenditure to ₹50-60 crore from over ₹200 crore.

380.title: Flying car prototype worth ₹2.5 crore whose sides become wings unveiled in US
380.article_body: American startup Alef Aeronautics has unveiled a flying car prototype costing $300,000 (about ₹2.5 crore). The car features a body that flips on its side to become the wings after lift-off and mesh on its top surface to let air flow through. It can be driven on a regular street and is capable of vertical take off and landing.

381.title: Jennifer Aniston reached out the most: Perry on his substance abuse
381.article_body: Actor Matthew Perry said his 'Friends' co-star Jennifer Aniston had confronted him about his alcohol and drug abuse, and often reached out to him. "She was the one who reached out the most. I'm really grateful to her for that," he said. Perry recalled taking 55 Vicodin a day during 'Friends' and admitted that he "didn't know how to stop".

382.title: Amitabh Bachchan reveals he cut a vein on his left calf, was rushed to hospital
382.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan has said that he was recently rushed to a hospital after he cut a vein on his left calf. "A jutting piece of metal sliced my left calf and managed to cut the vein...the vein when cut spurts out the 'red' uncontrollably," he wrote in his blog. He added that he received stitches to control the bleeding.

383.title: Pak have better quality in death overs: Hogg on T20 WC match vs India
383.article_body: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Pakistan "definitely" have better quality in their bowling department in the death overs in comparison to India, ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022 match between the sides. "When it comes to middle overs, India have better spinners than...Pakistan...They have spinners who can pick up wickets but also nullify the run-rate," added Hogg.

384.title: Congress suspends rape accused Kerala MLA Eldhose Kunnappilly
384.article_body: The Congress in Kerala suspended rape accused MLA Eldhose Kunnappilly for six months. "The explanation provided by him on the allegations was not satisfactory. As a representative of the people, he failed to exercise due diligence," the Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee said. A woman had recently filed a rape and attempt to murder case against him.

385.title: Top marketing officer sexually harasses ex-staffer in Mumbai; booked
385.article_body: The Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) of a leading financial company was booked for allegedly sexually harassing a former female employee in Mumbai. The woman claimed that the accused had also threatened to fire her when she refused his sexual advances, according to police. The woman was reportedly fired after the HR department gave clean chit to the accused in 2020.

386.title: Video of 4 men offering namaz inside train in UP surfaces, Railway police launches probe
386.article_body: A video of four men offering namaz inside a train stationed near the Khadda railway station in Uttar Pradesh’s Kushinagar has surfaced on social media. The video was shared by former BJP MLA from Kushinagar Deeplal Bharati. Meanwhile, the Railway police said it has launched a probe into the matter though no FIR has been filed.

387.title: 70-yr-old retired police officer dies after fire engulfs house in Lucknow
387.article_body: A 70-year-old retired Inspector General (IG) of Police died while his wife and son were injured when a fire broke out in their house in Lucknow’s Indira Nagar on Saturday, police said. The fire broke out on the first floor of retired IG DC Pandey’s residence, trapping him and his family. A detailed probe is underway into the matter.

388.title: Helicopter narrowly misses vehicles on Ukraine road; video surfaces
388.article_body: Ukraine's Defense Ministry has shared a video which shows a helicopter narrowly missing vehicles on a road in the country, with the caption, "Welcome to Ukraine." A Twitter user reacted to the video, saying, "Below the radar has a new meaning," while another user tweeted, "Not your typical way to commute to work, but everyone has a job to do."

389.title: India announce their playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan
389.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to field first against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Melbourne. India have left out Deepak Hooda, Rishabh Pant, Yuzvendra Chahal and Harshal Patel from the playing XI. Mohammad Shami, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Arshdeep Singh are the three main fast bowlers in India's playing XI.

390.title: All your pain goes away when you take the field against Pak: Sehwag
390.article_body: Sharing his experience while facing Pakistan, ahead of India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan, Virender Sehwag said, "No matter how much pain you're in, it...goes away when you take the field against them." Discussing the T20 World Cup 2022 match between the sides, Sehwag stated, "It's a big ground...Be very sure before sending the ball over the boundary."

391.title: What is India's record against Pakistan in T20I cricket?
391.article_body: India and Pakistan have played 11 T20Is against each other, with India winning eight times, including one through a bowl out. India have lost two of their last three T20I matches against Pakistan, including a 10-wicket defeat in T20 World Cup 2021. The T20 World Cup 2022 match will be India-Pakistan's first encounter against each other in Australia.

392.title: Minister slaps woman, she touches his feet in Karnataka; video surfaces
392.article_body: A video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman in Chamarajanagar district during a public event to distribute land title deeds is being widely shared online. The woman could be seen touching the minister's feet after he slaps her. The woman, Kempamma, came to the venue and claimed the selection process for beneficiaries was rigged.

393.title: Pune court grants Father Vincent Pereira bail in the POCSO case
393.article_body: A Pune court on Friday granted bail to Father Vincent Pereira, who was booked under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POCSO) for alleged sexual abuse of a 15-year-old boy. The FIR stated that Father Pereira sexually abused the minor boy while two other prominent members of the church allegedly did not act against him.

394.title: Which Indians have smashed the most number of sixes against Pakistan in T20I cricket?
394.article_body: Among Indians, Yuvraj Singh has slammed the most number of sixes against Pakistan in T20I cricket. He slammed nine maximums in eight innings against Pakistan. He is followed by Virat Kohli (seven), Rohit Sharma (six) and Gautam Gambhir (three). Meanwhile, among Pakistanis, Muhammad Rizwan has slammed the most sixes against India in T20I cricket, with six maximums.

395.title: UP woman raped by stepson, husband's colleagues writes to Prez seeking euthanasia
395.article_body: A 30-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh, allegedly raped by her stepson and gang-raped by her husband's colleagues, has written a letter to President Droupadi Murmu seeking euthanasia. She wrote, "I've lost all my hope in justice. Despite the court's order, police haven't arrested any of the accused." The woman got married to a 55-year-old farmer, three years after her divorce.

396.title: My father tore govt job letter, started Cycle Agarbathies with ₹4,000: Ranga Rao's son
396.article_body: N Ranga Rao, the Founder of Cycle Brand Agarbathies, started his incense business by borrowing ₹4,000 in 1948 after pawning his wife's jewellery. Ranga Rao applied for a central government job after failing in trading and dairy farming, his son Mohan Rangarao revealed. However, he tore up the appointment letter and pursued his dream of becoming an entrepreneur, he added.

397.title: Odisha family says pet dog died due to negligence, FIR filed against doctor
397.article_body: An FIR was filed against a veterinary doctor after a family alleged that their pet dog Dugu died due to negligence of the doctor in Odisha. The dog died on October 17. The family kept his body for four days, hoping for postmortem to find exact cause of his death. The dog died after being brought home from the hospital.

398.title: Audience holds 'Vande Mataram' flags at RRR's Japan screening, makers react
398.article_body: 'RRR' makers on Saturday shared a video in which the Japanese audience was seen holding flags with 'Vande Mataram' written over them. The makers tweeted, "Proud moment for us to see the Vande Mataram flag in the hands of the Japanese and their love towards India at the screening of 'RRR'." The film had its Japan premiere on October 21.

399.title: No player might've faced such pressure: Ajay Jadeja on India-Pak T20 WC match
399.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said "no player" might have experienced similar pressure as that set to be experienced by players featuring in the T20 World Cup 2022 match between India and Pakistan. "I doubt we will ever witness a larger crowd than this for an India-Pakistan contest," added Ajay. "India are the better side...There is absolutely no doubt," he stated.

400.title: This Pakistani team is very challenging: Rohit ahead of T20 WC 2022 match
400.article_body: Discussing India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan, Rohit Sharma said, "This Pakistani team is...very challenging...They've been playing good cricket." "All the Pakistan teams I've played...from 2007 to 2022, they've been...good teams," added Rohit. Sharing his approach for the match, Rohit stated, "When we enter the ground...I'll be focused on...[putting] the opposition under pressure."

401.title: Pakistan have the best bowling attack in T20 World Cup 2022: Gambhir
401.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Pakistan have the "best" bowling attack in T20 World Cup 2022. "If you look at Australia, they've just one bowler who can bowl over 140 kmph. For England, Mark Wood can bowl over 150 kmph," added Gambhir. "For Pakistan, Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf and Naseem Shah...can bowl over 140 kmph. Fast bowling is their strength," he stated.

402.title: US girl steals $13,500 from grandmother, gives it to classmates
402.article_body: A 14-year-old girl is facing a grand theft charge after she allegedly stole $13,500 from her grandmother's safe and handed out over $10,000 to her classmates in US' Florida. Officials have recovered about $2,500 from the girl's backpack and around $700 from other students at her school. The arrest report does not mention the reason behind the incident.

403.title: Pakistan have the best bowling in T20 World Cup 2022: Gambhir
403.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Pakistan have the "best" bowling in T20 World Cup 2022. "If you look at Australia, they have just one bowler who can bowl over 140 kmph. For England, Mark Wood can bowl over 150 kmph," added Gambhir. "For Pakistan, Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf and Naseem Shah...can bowl over 140 kmph. Fast bowling is their strength," he stated.

404.title: Plane crashes into building in New Hampshire; 2 on board plane dead
404.article_body: Two people who were on board a small plane died after it crashed into a building in Keene in US' New Hampshire, authorities said. Eight people who were living in an apartment building, connected to the building hit by the plane, were evacuated after a fire broke out. The cause of crash remains under investigation, Keene Mayor George Hansel said.

405.title: PM Modi congratulates ISRO on successful launch of 36 OneWeb satellites
405.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on the successful launch of its heaviest rocket with 36 OneWeb satellites. "Congratulations...on the successful launch of our heaviest launch vehicle LVM3 with 36 OneWeb satellites...LVM3 exemplifies Atmanirbharta...and enhances India's competitive edge in global commercial launch service market," he tweeted.

406.title: 4 men tie up & gangrape 32-yr-old nurse at health centre in Chhattisgarh, record act
406.article_body: Four men allegedly tied up and gangraped a 32-year-old nurse who was working alone at a health centre in Chhattisgarh's Manendragarh district. The nurse alleged that the accused recorded the assault and threatened to murder her if she went to the police. Police have arrested three of the accused, including a 17-year-old boy.

407.title: PM constantly sought to create new avenues for jobs for youth: Union Minister
407.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has constantly sought to create new avenues and opportunities for livelihood, income and government jobs for the country’s youth, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said on Saturday. Furthermore, Singh said that right from the beginning, the Prime Minister has given the highest priority to the issues related to the youth.

408.title: Balenciaga, Vogue cut ties with Kanye West over his anti-Semitic comments
408.article_body: Fashion house Balenciaga and fashion magazine Vogue have announced that they'll no longer work with Kanye West. The announcement has come weeks after West's anti-Semitic remarks. "Balenciaga has no longer any relationship nor any plans for future projects related to this artist," the brand's parent company said in a statement. West made his modelling debut at Balenciaga's 2023 show.

409.title: 30-yr-old labourer returning to Bihar dies after cough bout at Pune station
409.article_body: A 30-year-old labourer who was returning to his home in Bihar died after he suffered a bout of cough at Pune Railway Station. The Government Railway Police have denied that the man died during a stampede at the railway station amid a huge rush of people heading home for Diwali. Police said the man was unwell, according to primary investigations.

410.title: Suryakumar Yadav, Babar Azam rate their own skills out of 100
410.article_body: The ICC has shared videos of Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan captain Babar Azam rating their skills out of 100. Suryakumar rated his power 90, stroke range 93, spin-playing skills 95, pace-playing skills 93 and his fielding 90. Meanwhile, Babar rated his power 70, stroke range 80, spin-playing skills 75, pace-playing skills 90 and his fielding 60.

411.title: Actors of 90s like SRK or Aamir still understand story's importance: Ghai
411.article_body: Director Subhash Ghai said that the actors of 90s, such as Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan or Aamir Khan, "still understand the importance of" a film's story, but today's generation of actors "wants the money to come first". Ghai said, "They are just bothered about their personal branding and fees; they feel they have become big brands."

412.title: 5 charged after US daycare worker scared kids with Halloween mask
412.article_body: After a video surfaced of a daycare worker scaring children while wearing a Halloween mask in US' Mississippi, four people linked to the video are facing child abuse charges while a fifth person is facing two misdemeanour counts, authorities said. The video showed children crying and running from the masked worker. The owner of the daycare isn't facing any charges.

413.title: US VP Kamala Harris hosts Diwali celebrations in Washington, videos surface
413.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris hosted Diwali celebrations at her official residence, the Naval Observatory, on Friday. Some videos that surfaced on social media from the event showed her lighting sparklers along with her husband and Second Gentleman, Doug Emhoff, and wishing each other 'Happy Diwali'. Several prominent Indian Americans were present at the event.

414.title: K'taka Deputy Speaker Anand Mamani passes away at 56, CM pays tribute
414.article_body: The Deputy Speaker of Karnataka, Anand Mamani (56), passed away late Saturday night in the Manipal Hospital in Bengaluru. He was battling ill health for more than a month. Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai paid tribute to his party colleague and said, "I pray that God rest his soul in eternal peace and give his family strength to bear this pain."

415.title: Army Chief, his wife visit Army Base Hospital in Delhi
415.article_body: Chief of Army staff General Manoj Pande and his wife Archana Pande visited the Base Hospital, Delhi Cantt on Saturday and interacted with the serving soldiers and their families. He also lauded the efforts of paramedics for ensuring a conducive healthcare ecosystem. He took over as the new Chief of Army Staff from General Manoj Mukund Naravane on April 30.

416.title: 8 drug peddlers transporting 480 kg ganja held: Rachakonda Police
416.article_body: Rachakonda Police tweeted on Saturday that eight inter-state drug peddlers who were transporting 480 kg of ganja were arrested by Hayathnagar police. The accused were transporting ganja, which they would sell for ₹20,000 per kg, from Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam to Hyderabad and Karnataka, the police said. The accused were detained under the Preventive Detention Act, the police added.

417.title: Rohit Sharma dons mic while practising in nets, ICC shares video
417.article_body: The ICC has shared a video of India captain Rohit Sharma practising in the nets while donning a mic. In the video, Rohit can be heard calling Shami "most dangerous" bowler. "You're swinging the ball very late. I can see everything," he was also heard telling a bowler. He was also seen praising Dinesh Karthik for one of his shots.

418.title: Not here to have a nice and easy time or build a 'me too' company: Ola CEO
418.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal at the company's recent launch event said, "We're not here to build a 'me too' company, we're not here to have a nice and easy time." Addressing allegations of a "hostile" work culture at Ola, Aggarwal said, "We are a very ambitious company." Ola has a culture of high quality and high execution, the 37-year-old added.

419.title: Video shows launch of ISRO's heaviest rocket with 36 satellites on board
419.article_body: OneWeb has shared a video showing the launch of ISRO's heaviest rocket carrying the startup's 36 broadband satellites on board. The LVM3 rocket lifted off from the Sriharikota spaceport just after midnight, marking its first commercial satellite launch. At 1.42 am on Sunday, the ISRO confirmed that the mission was completed successfully, with all 36 satellites placed into intended orbits.

420.title: 4 die, over 40 injured as bus meets with accident on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
420.article_body: Four people were killed while about 42 people were injured after a sleeper bus met with an accident on Agra-Lucknow Expressway. The sleeper bus was en route to Ajmer from Gorakhpur. "While praying for peace for the soul of the departed, the Chief Minister has expressed condolences to the bereaved families," a tweet from the CM Office read.

421.title: India reports 1,994 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 23,432
421.article_body: India reported 1,994 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,112 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases now stand at 23,432. The data showed that 2,601 people recovered in the last 24 hours. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,961.

422.title: Chinese President Xi Jinping secures historic 3rd term in power
422.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has secured a historic third five-year term after he was elected to the Central Committee by the ruling Communist Party on Saturday, making him the nation's most influential leader since founder Mao Zedong. "I wish to thank the whole Party sincerely for the trust you have placed in us," Jinping told journalists on Sunday.

423.title: 27-year-old drug peddler arrested in Hyderabad, 30 gm of MDMA seized
423.article_body: A 27-year-old man, who was allegedly in possession of MDMA, was arrested by the Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing (H-NEW) in coordination with the Golconda Police. The police seized 30 grams of MDMA, a phone and ₹3,000 cash from the accused, a native of UP. He purportedly purchased psychotropic drugs from dealers and supplied them to consumers in Mumbai and Hyderabad.

424.title: They wouldn't cast me as lead because I'm fat: Maanvi on being body shamed
424.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo opened up about being body shamed in the film industry and said that people didn't want to cast her as the lead of their projects because she was fat. "They didn't know what category to fit me in," she said. Maanvi added that she's yet to accept herself and believe that she's perfect as she is.
